reviews.text: Beautiful historic place to visit.
Impressive historic location, not a destination unless you're dealing with NYC Parks admin. Close enough to zoo, cafes, etc. within central park!
Amazing and beautiful Place!
I need to come here more often...enough said.
What's the entry fee. Want to go with kids

Absolutely loved this part of central park. Beautiful historical structure with the lovely surprise of the ceiling underneath the terrace. I had no idea this was here before my trip but I'm very glad to have found it. If you're walking around central park you must find the Bethesda Terrace and spend a bit of time looking around. Theres also public restrooms hidden underneath the steps in case you need to take nature's call.

Photographer picked this location for maternity shoot. It was a bit dank and dim because of winter and cold to boot, but, the lighted painted ceiling is gorgeous and frescos on the wall are nice to look at. The columns frame a large staircase which are also ideal for photos as is the massive fountain at the end. Quite lovely overall.

No wonder Central Park Conservancy chose this beautiful spot as the centerpiece of their extensive renovation project for the entire Park, in the early 1980s.
Having opened in 1863, it even housed an outdoor luncheon, in the 1960s, to then become peace territory for hippies while their dream lasted, before turning into a drug-trafficking venue in the 1970s.
It is now an informal stage for street performers, including some talented singers and musicians (the finest usually to be found in the arcade), and a much sought background for wedding photography. It’s actually neat to watch a stream of fancifully dressed couples cascading down the stairs. 
Yet, it can be pretty quiet and a contemplative place early in the morning.
I especially love how the golden ceiling of the arcade catches the light from outside — and reflects it from the pavement too —, to gleam beautifully, while bringing light to the length of the passage, making those Milton encaustic tiles shine to splendor.
It bears witness to how many generations of visitors? How many stories must have unfolded on its grounds? Ambling here one steps on top of countless invisible steps (one usually does, almost anywhere in towns), and in the arcade the feeling is of being in a time tunnel...
Quite a magical portal in NYC.
An iconic place of central park. If you go to the park this should definitely be on the of the list. So many movies use this location that's its instantly recognizable.

Beautiful place ! It has a very unique vibe, it usually has street art, such as people singing or playing instruments. The view it’s very nice and it has a vibe to Italy renascent era. 
If you are around Central Park, go over there, it’s worth visiting as it is an iconic place.

A wonderful, small visitor's center and gift shop in the southern half of Central Park. There are free maps and plenty of items (shirts, books, gifts, posters) associated with Central Park for purchase. The staff are friendly, and I'd recommend stopping by to figure out where to go in Central Park or to pick up a gift and help support Central Park.
Such a beautiful place!!! The workers were so nice and explained on a map where things were. And the prices for goods wasn't crazy expensive but around $8 for a really nice gift
cute little shop when your walking around the park

The Dairy Visitor Center and Gift shop is nice, BUT the reason this is a 5 is because if you have made it here, and you are interested in finding the remaining hidden survey bolt in Central Park, you are 'warm', so close. The bolt was put in the ground by John Randel Jr. in the early 1800's, as he planned the Manhattan grid we know today (google it). It's much smaller than you think, and it's exact location is kept a secret by those that know where it is... it's a bit of a treasure hunt.
Lovely stuff beer really expensive.

I stumbled upon this beautiful place while walking home from downtown Brooklyn and really enjoyed the peaceful trail in the midst of the busy traffic. This is a nice place to relax and enjoy the sunshine, Reading a book or meditating.
Very nice place to hang out with family and friends. You have nearby the park, boating and  beautiful seanaries
Nice Plaza right across from Prospect Park. Nice place to take pictures and hang out a while. There are a couple of subway stations nearby.
Huge park in Brooklyn. Lots to see on your run or jog, also a great place to take kids
Nice place, nice people Right off Eastern Parkway. Corner of train station is very windy...lol..I lost my shades in the traffic when the wind blew them off my head.Lol

Gorgeous meadow, next to two bathrooms, volley ball, water fountain in the heart of central Park great place for hanging out and being cute on a gorgeous spring/summer day

- the downside of this wonderful place is that EVERYONE knows how wonderful it is; be aware it is always crowded.

Be prepared for sharing space and having an interesting time trying to find your friends

Sheep Meadow wasn't bad, I was able to let my kids run. There are a lot of holes though. And not everyone cleans up after their dogs. My recommendation to owners is; bring your bags and pick up after them, Please.
Nice and relaxing even though it's full of people. If you need a place to read, or to just lay down, this field is definitely a solid option to go to.
I was here in the early spring and it was absolutely lovely seeing all of the trees in bloom. Great spot in central park to lay down and relax or enjoy a walk around.
In the summer you'll see the locals using this as their personal suntan ING spot. Running around the outside perimeter is just about a mile. No ball playing.
Is the only one castle in United States and was an astronomical place. Beautiful views of central park from the castle. Let run your imagination in a fantasy place .
Wildlife in central park? The exhibits can explain all.

Thanks for this and the last thing I want to go to the preaching though I have a Lamborghinis driving the mustang. Just for laughs and the story of the Caribbean piano and it did not. Although the other songs were recorded in the morning so we'll be able to get under your skin. The head of the Caribbean piano was a tremendous opportunity for laughs of a demon. No idea how much is a legend and the last time do u want to have it here, but i was going to be able to get under the bus and maybe even get a stronger neck. Thanks for the other hand that you gave me. Quite delicious. I hope you are not being silly and I hope you do not heap sugar into your ears. Just goes to show what an incredible person Phil is. Good day and good night. TOOTAL LOO!!
Closed for renovations, no signs up so we wasted about 20 minutes looking for it.
It was cool but it is closing for concrtuction

6 softball fields and 2 more off to the side offers the best softball playing experience that any player can have. The Great Lawn is a huge, big green grassed area that open for frisbee to just sunbathing. No wonder concerts are held here as a special events place! Lovely place to check while in town!
Catch the amazing cherry blossoms right now during the spring time!

The great lawn is a great place to have a picnic or sit and enjoy nature. There are many people around you, but there is a way to get away from them. I go here just to relax. There is also a bathroom here, and there is a lot of space to walk around in.

The great lawn is a beautiful place without a doubt. Never had any issues when being there. That's until the day of the global citizens festival! Never seen such an unorganized concert in my life! People were skipping, there was a stampede and everything. Never going to a free concert there again.
Great spot in the middle of the park. Gorgeous

Definitely a neat little spot to relax and escape from the bustle of the city for a while. Climbing the ramble is a fun little exercise and I thought the view was pretty good. The walk to get to the Ramble is super pretty, and trails are provided so you can explore the little stream that passes nearby it. If you’re looking for a place to relax in Central Park, this is a good place to do it!

Really nice spot in central park to unwind with a bit of birdwatching. Cold but rewarding particularly near the bird feeders with loads to see. Favourite this time was a white bellied nuthatch. Very common but really cute.
As The Weather Gets Nice, This Is A Very Nice Place To Visit...!
This is my favorite place in Central Park.  A maze of pathways between boulders and along the water.  It’s a great place for a walk, and one of the best bird watching spots in the city.
A great escape from the frantic energy of the city. I've seen some beautiful birds here!

Very nice staff! Kids' discovery packs are free and made a great addition to our trek around the lake. We used the binoculars to observe a group of turtles sunning themselves on a rock. Great way to spend a spring day.

Central Park has so much to offer and this place is one of them! They offer a wide variety of free education and community programs, seasonal exhibits, and holiday celebrations! You can borrow a fishing pole,
borrow a free, kid-friendly Discovery Kit filled with field guides, binoculars and art supplies and also Get a free, kid-friendly Discovery Journal with activities to enhance your visit. SO make sure you visit and maximise your discovery!
Lovely albeit too "fixed" middle-aged lady is working there, pleasant service. Even mediocre lavatories are free to use.

The people there were very helpful.  There was great historic information on Central Park that was fascinating.
If weather permits step out on the tiny deck for a beautiful park photo.

This is an excellent place to bring your children for a day of learning, great views and of course fishing. Yes, that's rite, fishing! The discovery center will rent you poles, at no cost, aslong as you leave behind your ID. You may fish until the center is closes, the catch is (pun intended) you have to throw back any fish caught. They're also alot of turtles in the lake, so keep an eye out. Hope this helps, enjoy!

My daily trek to watch the 🐦's and listen to the babbling  water and many waterfalls.

You will meet people you see often and most everyone is respectful of the environment and the wildlife.
Less trafficked area of Central Park in comparison to the southern end of the park. Nice area to walk through with some elevation.

very relaxing and cool hike! it was my first time been that place and i love it.This place has very unique vegetation which make it very special.It was very relaxing and awesome hike.There is a free parking right on the entrance.we saw mcfalloak where we sat down and drink tea. dogs are allowed!
Always a great view when we visit any use toon of Central Park
Beautiful place with trails and boulders. Be careful on the boulders, I dropped my phone and luckily it didn't smash the screen.
Excellent proper pub with great view over bay. Ever changing choice of ales and great gins. Very friendly staff, good food and best place in Falmouth to watch  live sport
Great classic pub with great local food amazing food and comfy vibe. I'd highly recommend it.

We came here as part of o 25 strong group For dinner .we were all asked to arrive promptly as our pre ordered food would be served for 7pm sharp.Unfortunately not the case.the mains came out in twos and threes,some of us had finished eating before others had received theirs.!!
The food itself was Ok but have had better for the price!. Beer drinkers also beware ,the range of draft beers is light on well knowns .I tried a couple of pints of their real ales but wasn’t bowled over.After spending nearly £80 There I won’t be in a hurry to return,Need to do better.
Its got some good ales a unique outside sitting area with fantastic views

A very nice, traditional pub.
The view across the Penryn to Flushing and across the Carrick Roads is stunning, especially in the evening as the sun sets.

My fiance and I stopped into Tavern on the green for some breakfast on our first morning in NYC. What a great start to the trip. The service was first class and the recommendations from our waiter turned out to be perfect. Bloody Mary's are the best I've ever tasted and the Eggs Benedict was phenomenal. Highly recommended and the next time I'm in New York, I'll definitely be returning. A++

This place is simply beautiful and an iconic NYC restaurant. We went there for that, and for the fact that we read great reviews on their lobster bisque. Unfortunately they did not have this soup on the menu. We ordered from the menu and the food was fine, but not the overwhelming wonderful fare we were hoping for. They did have live music which was nice, but we were seated so far from it we couldn't hear it until we were on our way out. Glad we went though!

Excellent service and delicious food. We actually mistakenly made reservations for the following night, but they fit us in and got us a table with no problems. Had the restaurant week menu and it was so good! I got the chicken, juicy and perfectly cooked, the wife got the shirt rib which was tender and delicious. The grits on that short rib plate were sublime. I recommend added the wine tasting to your meal! They were an excellent match.

We went for Sunday brunch. The steak and eggs was very good and my boyfriend got the tavern burger.

Our server was great, the place is iconic and beautiful and the food is fantastic.  You can make reservations ahead too. Oh and Central Park is right outside for exploring before/after. There is literally no reason not to go here while in NYC!

Food is very good, but service at the bar for Sunday brunch is terrible. Had the same male bartender 2 times in a row now, and he seems oblivious to customers unless they want to hear his dating exploits which he goes into ad nauseum. Disappeared at one point for about 10 minutes with a busy bar. Made an Irish Coffee for lady next to us and then added whiskey after it was made and spilled it all over bar. He said, oops that's not the way I had it planned. He never made an attempt to clean it up and just walked off. We had to offer the lady cocktail napkins to clean it up. Had to repeatedly ask for items like salt and pepper, check etc., had to pour our own wine from the bottle we ordered, etc. The bar is a great atmosphere, but deserves better service. It appears the table waiters in the bar area do a good job, but bar service needs vastly improved. If this continues, no more brunch on Sunday's for us. We have had a very good female bartender, but she is not often there.

Beautifully constructed boutique museum with permanent and temporary exhibits of Asian art. Interactive exhibits well suited for young and old alike. A wonderful restaurant on the ground floor serves delicious salads, appetizers, sandwiches and main courses with an Asian influence. Mulligatawny soup is the best I have ever tasted!

It was my first time there with my college class. We were a group of about 15 and we didn't feel in the way, it was roomy enough for us to do out lesson, and it was quite enough for us to have discussions. I will be going back on my own...it was amazing!

Honestly surprised at how much I liked this museum. The general atmosphere of rich-white-person-discovers-the-orient that dominates the gift shop (expensive Om throw pillows, Herman Hesse novels, etc etc) was thankfully absent in the exhibits themselves. The museum takes its area of focus (Buddhism) seriously and has a good mix of historic pieces and work by contemporary artists. As an added bonus, it's free Friday evenings.
The food was amazing.  I went with my daughter and she loved it. My only complaint was the bacon was to hard but EVERYTHING else was amazing so I am giving them a 5 star nonetheless.

This peaceful museum became an unlikely favorite of mine. I'm neither scholar nor student of Eastern religion and tradition. Yet, I return again and again to find truly interactive installations, superior contemporary works and engaging displays of artifacts. On a recent trip, I stepped across an artist's water pond...and noticed the shrine room has expanded to include chairs and shared meditation beads. This museum is truly a model for others to follow. The cafe is excellent. The only area in need of fresh ideas is the gift shop.

Beautiful pieces, unique visuals. 
Excellent staff, especially the ones on the floor in black suits. 
This 1 light skin Guy wit a well groomed beard, tall, I think his name is Anthony or Andy, he said it was his first day and he was a delight. 
That type of customer service is appreciated and I recommend this gallery to all my friends and everyone interested.
Art gallery Chelsea.  Polite front desk.
Brilliant space. Always the best artists on display.
Nice people and interesting stuff!
Great art space. Good art shows
아름다운건물

The comedy shows are awesome! They bring in a lot of talent. The food is pretty good, too. My only gripe is with the beer. Don't get me wrong, the selection is alright, and so is everything that comes in a can or a bottle. However, for whatever reason, the stuff they have on tap is always a bit watery and musky. Aside from that, this place is great, and I highly recommend that you check it out!

Amazing food for a "bar" I had the steak and cheese and roasted brussel sprouts. Went for the comedy night, well worth the price. Show up 30 minutes early for good seats. You can eat during the show, but service to the tables can be slow during a sold out event, so it's wise to get food early. Drinks are a decent price. Don't hesitate on getting tickets as day of the show it typically sells out

Great music but 1 of the female bartenders was very rude and threw a straw at me when I asked for one after she didn't stir a cocktail after making it. All other staff was friendly and despite this, I had a great time!
funny and I did open mic night and the audience is great too
My son performed there great place atmosphere and food Nd drinks on point!!

You WILL wait in line. But you will wait in line at most places like this here... The difference? This one is one of the best. 
Get the special. Just get it. Don't ask questions. Just get. And eat. And savour. Your mouth will be happy. If you're vegan/dairy-free - there's options for you too! 

The staff is friendly, efficient, and they know what they're doing. When I'm back home in Canada, I dream of this place.

Very busy, but lots of options! I ordered my bagels for take-out since the place was packed at noon on a Sunday. Bagels themselves were excellent-- we ordered a salmon lox on an everything bagel & a walnut cinnamon raisin spread on a cinnamon raisin bagel. Will definitely consider next time I am in NYC.

This is one of my favorite places in New York. bagel are amazing and they have a pretty large selection of bagels+filling. The service was really good but tend to be very crowded in the mornings. My recommendation is the smoked salmon with cream cheese bagel!
Amazing food and service. Lots of people but the line moved quickly and cleanly. I can't wait to go back to try more things on the menu. Thank you.
Awesome fillings for bagels. I love the salmon lox but they have so many choices. The bagels themselves are good too.

one of the best Spanish restaurants I've been to outside of actual Spanish countries. everything is made fresh and the plate combinations are amazing. I make sure to eat here every time I go to AC. the food is upscale in price but it's worth every penny. the view of the ocean and ambient lighting make it a great date spot too. strongly recommended

The only reason I gave this restaurant a 1 is because selecting 0 wasn't an option. My party of 6 was waiting for over an hour after being told 10-15 minutes. We watched as several parties of 5 were seated before us. After waiting for so long we were seated at two high round tables that were pushed together. The space was not adequate enough to fit our food, let alone it wasn't comfortable. As we sat down we noticed a rectangular table was being cleaned and opened. We asked our server if we could move over to the open table. Our server asked the women who are responsible for seating and they explained that the table was already taken. My party watched as the table remained empty for over 20 more minutes. As we waited we spoke to a manager regarding our issues. The manager explained that the table was reserved and there was nothing he could do for us. I would never return to a place with such poor service! I advise other people to steer clear of this Dos Caminos.

The food and service here is awesome! I am not a big fan of guacamole at ALL!! And let me tell you I would eat this guacamole all day long! Awesome food...awesome waitress and awesome staff period! Oh and the Chips was very fresh and warm when they was brought out to us!
Excellent food. Great staff. Our waitress ,Stephanie, was awesome. I highly  recommend eating here.

We came with a party of 17 and the wait staff did a nice job considering all the strong personalities that they had to deal with. The loss of star comes from the food. The food was good, but just nothing outstanding. 

My favorite item of the menu turned out to be their salsa verde that they served as an option with the chips. It was garlic forward on the pallet with a little heat in the back of the throat. It really was a great salsa. 

With that being said, it was the only memorable food item from the night.  Again, the food wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything I'd crave to come back for.

I asked my waiter, Joey, for a recommendation. He said that meat loaf and fried chicken were the 2 most popular dinners. I couldn't decide and asked him to order for me. He sent the chicken. It was amazing! It looked so good it started a conversation from the table next to me. Great food and unexpected friendship.

The food was great!! Drinks were great too!! Very friendly atmosphere and the employees were great as well. You would think the food portions are little but it was A LOT. Very filling and scrumptious food. I went for brunch, and it's definitely going to be my go to place for future brunches. I had the steak and eggs!

Everyone at the table had a great dish, from the burger, to the fish, to a salad, to the sweet potato fries, to the cheese quesadilla.They had several beers on tap, as well as a bunch of interesting cocktails. Service was great, and very attentive. We will definitely go there again, when in the neighborhood.
One of my favorite spots to hang and drink. Great Bartenders all super friendly. Amazing atmosphere with a good mix of people. Def a try

Always love it here. Great atmosphere and staff. Love the 🍛 food and drinks too! ❄️Winter they bring out the Bleu cheese stuffed olives...yes...for my 🍸🍸🍸 Martini(s)! What better way to ward off the chilly NYC air?!

After eating sushi at places recommended on the web, I read about this place in a magazine. Some lady said that she goes there once a week. It sounded interesting so we decided to try it. I had CHEF’S SELECTION OF TODAY’S BEST,  the best sushi I have ever had. I know I’m repeating myself but I have been to at least two Michelin sushi places and Momoya is in my opinion better than those. I will go again.

Exceptional professionalism, incredible kitchen team, and tantalizing flavors. Balanced dishes that combine sushi with Pan Pacific flair -- you cannot, simply cannot go wrong. Do order the crispy tuna sushi, the steak as an appetizer, the crispy shrimp, and everything else :) I've been over a dozen times since it opened and while the queues have gotten longer, the staff are top notch. I've left feeling supremely grateful each time. Absolutely worth the wait and journey here. Excellent value for offerings, and the ingredients are always fresh 🏆🙏🏼  Kudos!!!
Best sushi I’ve had in nyc for a while. Great service, super lively crowd. They open the front windows when it gets warm so it’s basically outdoor seating. Truffle tuna tortilla is a MUST try

Lively Japanese restaurant with a good selection of sushi and sashimi dishes. The service was a little spotty and inconsistent, possibly due to the lunch hour rush. Customers who arrived later and sat next to us received their food quicker. Nonetheless, food was delicious and would recommend another visit.
Wow! This place is amazing! Very authentic, ingredients are high quality. Service was great. Had to wait a bit, but totally worth it!

This place is beautiful, very Instagramable. Food is good, nice ambience but the service is not very great. We went here on a weekend it was full, reservation is required, we given our seats on our reserved time and then there was nothing. No server came for next 10 minutes for taking orders for drinks or for water. Food was good, their desserts are also great . But yeah service wise not a very friendly restaurant.

This place has been a long time favorite. I really miss the old atmosphere though. A warm rustic room with exposed brick just felt so inviting. Can't quite get into the slick cold blue. Only reason it's not 5 stars.
Nice Italian place, they have a lot of home made pasta, few options for pizza. All main Courses are from chicken though. Cod fish and salmon were very good, as well as desserts.

Love this place. The food is always on point and the daily specials are amazing. Been here many many times and I keep recommending it to friends or bringing new friends there. It feels like home, if you grew up Italian then you know what I mean.

Pepe Giallo was amazing! We were a walk in and were seated quickly even though the restaurant was full. The staff were so welcoming and friendly. Food was DELICIOUS and affordable. Cant wait to come back!!

Overall dinner experience here on a Friday evening was excellent. Wonderfully yummy food with lots of intricate flavors layered together. The desserts were excellent, too, particularly the chocolate flan. Drinks were great - we had both red and white sangria. The wait staff was very kind and attentive. Will definitely be coming back many times!

Four stars because the place (at least our servers) is a little self-important. They regard themselves a bit too proudly IMHO. 

Food is fantastic. Plates are overpriced for small tapas but very thoughtfully crafted. Great work put into combining ingredients into very tasty food. 

Room: Small warehousey room with low-budget vibe. Even for Chelsea, room is uninspiring. Not industrial. Not chic. Just kind of like a hollowed our trailer. 

In the end, all worth the trip and highly recommended.

Food was terrible. Many of the dishes were served on stale French bread and were too greasy. Had a lamb shank with a nice seasoning but it was way over cooked and a well cooked suckling pig that was bland. We also found a large piece of tinfoil in one of the tapas. Very expensive for food that is below average. Service was good.
Great Basque food! Casual, comfortable and very exciting dining. One of our NYC favorites.
Superb Basque restaurant, right in the middle of Chelsea. The food is among the best in New York City, and the staff is friendly and unassuming.

Whole Foods always has good customer service the employees are always willing to answer any questions you have. Yesterday I was at the one at Carlisle I could actually make a day of it. They have so much to choose from and their deli are definitely to die for. The only one thing is I wish the prices were a little lower. The bakery is also very good. 👍👍👍🤔and the thought full sign is hoping they will drop their prices a bit.

Stopped here while traveling to visit family. Bought from the salad bar and the best organic cherry tomatoes for my son. Very nice store and was busy. Surprised by the mention of Amazon prime memberships at the register when paying them

The quality of food here is plummeting. I have found dirt in my ground beef twice now: two weeks in a row. Recently we found plastic in the clam chowder. Its not really what I would expect from Whole foods. I would like to continue shopping here but I am a little worried.

I only come here for the unhealthy food or when I really want some good meat or cheese. I don't give a hoot about the healthy organic all natural buzzword food. Personally, it's overrated, overpriced, and not worth it. But that bakery? I will eat all 1000 calories of that tiny little cake. No regrets. 
Good selection of cheese, great place for fresh meat and local coffee. 

Also, there seems to be bar soap everywhere. Really.. it seemed every 2-3 aisles there was a display for some sort of soap. So much so that I'm beginning to think that this Whole Foods location is trying to tell us we smell bad. Well jokes on you Whole Foods! I showered at least twice since I last visited 3 months ago! 

Generally very friendly staff though! Even if they think we smell bad..
Can I get a smile from anyone in this place? Healthy living what about been good to one another.  $ changes people.  #compassion #bekind #smile
Great food! Lovely location! Fantastic service! Will highly recommend to anyone visiting Apia - especially if you are after a great Italian meal :)
Absolutely exceptional service and divine food.  Fabulous atmosphere and great location on the waterfront to watch the sunset!  A must-do if wanting to dine out in Apia!
What a delight! Food, service, location and decor. Very kid friendly and the menu just perfect.

Been 3 times during our 2 week stay
Very nice food and great service and atmosphere

Nice located restaurant with great food. Always busy as it is one of the most famous in Apia but worth to wait. You get assigned to the waiting area until they have a table free. The price is on a higher level but it is worth to go at least once.

This little park in the heart of Chinatown is a good microcosm of the retired life. On any given day, the park is occupied with clusters of senior citizens around the tables. You might wonder why everyone is huddled around the tables. Turns out they're playing Chinese chess.

The game can get intense and crowds can get as big as 30 strong. If you just bought some street food, say from the Chinese Couple Vendor on Canal St, you can take it to this park and watch the interesting people.

There are lots of board and ball games in this area played by locals! It is a nice sight and I appreciate the happiness the people showed in their faces. I would love to pass here every day for sightseeing but this area is far from my house. I removed one star because some corners need some scrubbing. I would definitely come back though.

Whoever you’re close to China Town stop by this park to people watch and take in the culture of the community. You will not be disappointed. I’m always amazed and make this a must stop whenever nearby.

Historic NYC Chinatown's social hub. There are daily live performance of traditional Chinese Opera tunes but elder amateur musicians, table games and neighborhood chatter. A fine place to watch the Lunar New Year Parades and Festivities in addition to a resting place after visiting the large amount of restaurants, shops and offices in the area. People of all races converge in this place and there are trails, playing fields, basketball courts and playgrounds for anyone to enjoy year round. Restrooms are found near Bayard Street and near the playgrounds south of Bayard Street, between Baxter and Mulberry Streets.

Columbus Park is a NYC park, and it is maintained by the City of New York Park's Department.  

It is located in Chinatown, NYC,   and situated behind the NYC Criminal Court on Baxter and Bayard Street.  

The park is kind of big for a NYC park, and it does have a basketball court, lawn for soccer matches, lots of benches in and outside the park, playground for the kids and toddlers with swings and other equipment.  

Then there tables and chairs also, some are chess tables and some are like picnic tables and long benches.  Plenty of tress and bushes also.  So breakfast and lunch in the park is great on beautiful NYC days.

The folks that frequents the park are moms & kids, nanny & kids, kids from schools there for recess, folks playing basketball,  folks playing soccer,  Attorneys,  District Attorneys, judges, Court Officers and Correction Officers.  It is 1 of the safest park in NYC. 

However, It would be a great NYC park to enjoy except there is a bunch of middle age and elderly locals ( men and women)  that occupies the park on a daily basis 365 days a year, and they occupied almost all the tables every day.  What these folks do is play all sorts of card games and other table games all day long, and they just grab and hold the tables for their games.  These folks also have some bad habits besides their bad manners, and I can not even name them for you  except to say to they should stop their bad habits in a NYC park.

The park does entertain tons of folks on a daily basis,  and there are NYC  Park's Department employees  on hand throughout the day maintaining  the park.  

However, the park always seems dirty and unkempt whenever I visited.   The several public toilets in the park is real dirty and usually overflowing with some water from somewhere.  

Do visit the park if you are in the neighborhood,  but remember to hit the bathrooms before you go.

Enjoy.
Very welcoming, small Greek (Romaniot) Synagogue and museum with some fine cultural programs. - Prof. Sylvain Cappell

Incredible center for Greek Jewish life. The only place in the Western hemisphere to learn about Romaniote Greek Jewish history and still see it practiced today. Delicious food, beautiful traditions, warm and welcoming people. They host an amazing Greek Jewish Festival every spring. Must visit.
A beautiful tiny jewel box, a reminder of Greek-Jewish continuity, this unique spot exudes heart and soul. For prayer services, the Women's section is upstairs...I enjoyed the birds eye view!

Kehila Kedosha Janina is a Romaniote Jewish synagogue in the Lower East Side.  

They offer free tours on of the synagogue itself on Sundays.  It's a tiny place, and so the tour doesn't last long, but after it you can go to the second floor and enjoy their equally small museum of Greek Jewish artifacts.  There are also books and t-shirts for sale.  The man giving the tour at the time I went was very friendly and you could tell was genuinely passionate about getting to share Greek Jewish history with interested people.  

Highly recommended if you're a fan of history and lesser known cultures.
Very welcoming and full of Greek history.  Kudos to the staff and families.

A transcendent experience. Totally amazing, one can almost go back in time here and feel the past. Hear the prayers, and listen to conversations a hundred years old. If you came from somewhere else come here, you will feel at home no matter what or who you worship. Highly recommended!

Beautiful historic place situated in China town. Built in 1887 Synagogue is old and famous and still popular. Very carefully maintained inside and outside. It's very difficult to have it cleaned due to number of tourists visiting the place. Lots of historical documents and artifacts pertaining to active immigrant arrival to NYC. On Mondays you pay what you wish to enter.

I visited years ago the China town Synagogue and museum built at the end of 19th century. I found the building is well kept and operated. The lady we got as guide was very kind, attentive most informative and ready to answer any questions from international visitors. We got to know that the Synagogue was not a worship place only, it also rendered services to immigrants as a travel office, legal assistance point,  loan bank, general and language school etc. primarily in the first half of 20th century. The local Jewish community did it best to assist people already arrived or would be immigrant family members or friends mostly from Eastern Europe. The tour in the Synagogue might take minimum 1.5 hours.

Amazing slice of Jewish and New York City history hidden away in Chinatown--of all places in New York City. Its a crowd relief from the usually pricy tourist attractions in the five borough of NYC. There are really knowledgeable and friendly museum guides who will narrate  each aspect of the exhibits.  This small culturally historic museum is a must visit!
Beautiful history about the Jewish journey in Manhattan.  Great informative tour.  About 45 minutes to an hour.  Near The Tennemant Museum which is a good place to go either before or after.

Half my family likes this place the other half does not. But we still congregate here every other Sunday to have breakfast together. It's one of the few restaurants that are actually open early in Chinatown. There's only 1 dish I like and it's the braised beef noodle soup. Everything else I order I just dump a lot of their special chili sauce (it's not super spicy but it's really savory), which is something you really can't find anywhere else. They actually package it and sell it; it's that good. 4 stars because of the chili sauce!
The quality of the noodles has gone way downhill.   The dumpling I got had barely any meat.   It was like a joke.  You're better off going to Big Wong for the noodle soups.

This place is one of my dependables for great food.  I know i will never be disappointed.  Been going here since i was a kid.  My mom would always come home with the duck and now j continue the tradition
Good for a quick but good bite. However can be slightly messy at times. I would give this a 4 ¾ if I could.

great Vietnamese restaurant at the heart of Chinatown. real authentic place with great food and unique atmosphere. the country duck is highly recommend and also the  soup bowels. I went there with my sister and we had an amazing meal

We keep ordering the ice cream cakes from here for family birthdays because they're so, so good. If you call a couple of days in advance you can customize your flavours but they usually also have some standard three-flavor combinations available. We're particularly fond of lychee/mango/strawberry. The ice cream here is very good! And the service is great too. They'll give you an ice pack with your ice cream cake if you need one while traveling with it.

Still one of the best Ice Cream places in Chinatown after so many years. This place is more known for their Oriental flavors than their traditional flavors so don't be afraid to try something new. My personal favorite flavor is black sesame. It's not pictured in this review. The flavors I chose this time were Don tot (Chinese Egg Custard) and Thai Ice Tea. There were both delicious. The store is a bit cramped but that's not what you're there for. You can also ask to try flavors before you decide on your purchase.
They have your standard flavors, but we opted for some of their unique offerings...dragon fruit, ginger and pumpkin pie. All were delicious. A single scoop will set you back around $5.

Overpriced and overly sweet. I have definitely had better tasting and better made black sesame ice cream than the mess I got from this joint. There is a place on East 10th by NYU which is much better and less crowded.

You must visit this place! Its perfect after having a big oriental meal in China town. They have a great mix of all time favourites and new asian fusion! There a tons of flavours to choose from you need to keep coming back to try them all! They offer ice cream cakes too! Absolutely a great idea when visiting China town in New York!

I walked over half an hour in the rain to get here. It was super worth it. The pork was tender and flavorful, the broth was delicious and complex, the dumplings were perfect, and the duck had a rich and crispy skin. The service was good, and they offered complementary tea, which kept flowing throughout the meal. For less than $15 I got 2 dishes, enough for dinner and leftovers tomorrow. Definitely check it out if you're in Chinatown, or even if you're not, it's worth heading out that way!

An absolute great place to eat in Chinatown! Easy to see right off of the Bowery.  Parking will always be a problem.  Open late which is awesome.   Usually a line, but it moves quickly.   Get the roast pork and any soup noodle dish.  You might even see a celebrity inside.   We will definitely be going back..
Fantastic food. Salt & pepper shrimp is to die for. And now soft shell crab is in season! Get it by the truckload! My coworkers and I often come here after work.

Love this place! Congee is amazing, barbecue meats are amazing and the Soy Sauce noodles are amazing! Sadly I love them so much I rarely try anything new, but I'm sure when I do it will also be amazingly amazing. Fast service and complimentary oranges to end your meal...you guessed it AMAZING! Cash only place but who cares. People are too dependent on cards. Every other place in the neighborhood might be good but this place is nothing short of amazing.  Every time I come I mean to take pictures to show off but I get too wrapped up in the food and by the time I remember I ate it all. Anyway if you are in Chinatown come to Bowery and Bayard so you too can be AMAZED!!!
It was good.. Just weird.. But super cheap.. I like super cheap and I weird..So, I likes this place and all its Asianess!! Bravo my friends

This is hands down the BEST meal New York has to offer. Authenticity is key for this little hole in the wall. Our group of 8 was seating quickly in this packed restaurant for a late lunch. It is community style eating, round tables and huge plates of food. The dumplings and lo mein were superb. I will never forget the soup inside the dumplings... my mouth is watering just thinking about it! There are two things I wish I would have known before going. First off, one order of food is enough for at least 2 people if not more. Each of us got our own plates not knowing this and had enough food to feed double. Not complaining, it makes for great leftovers. Secondly, you can not split the check and need to be able to pay in cash. 

This place might just be the perfect reason to go to New York. From one foodie to the other✨

Best soup dumpling in the city!! The service was so fast so I didn’t wait long to try these bad boy! Such a good price for quality and portion! It’s a highly recommended restaurant so don’t miss out when you’re in NYC!

Giving this place 5 stats for value. Joe's offers the best soup dumpling in the city. The restaurant is cash only and the wait is normally about an hour, but it is absolutely worth the wait. The food is incredibly cheap and the servings are large. You will be seated in a communal-style table with other people, but it wasn't a problem for me. Bring a large group and you can share and try many different menu items. A must for anyone visiting NYC from out of town. Great experiences every time I visit.
We were told it was a 15 minutes wait but got seated in 30. The service is fast and decent. I recommend this place if you are looking for quantity over quality.

Joe's Shanghai has amazing soup dumplings (I prefer the pork ones to the crab and pork hybrid ones), but the rest of their food is very greasy and average. I would definitely recommend coming here to fill up on soup dumplings and some appetizers, but the rest you can pass on. There's usually a line so go early to reserve a spot.

Super authentic and delicious spot. One of the only places to get good milk tea in all of Chinatown. The prices are fantastic for the amount of food, and the staff were all really nice. Great place, and just a vast selection of all-around comfort food classics (the french toast is out of this world, fried dough wrapped in rice noodle is bomb). Also recommend the beef satay noodle bowl, especially on a cold day.

Highly recommend, and will be back.

Price is fantastic everything is pretty much less than $10, hk milk tea was good, beef was tender. I got the instant noodles with spam and it wasn't that great. Noodles were a little too hard, needed to be cooked a little longer. All and all not bad for the price. Love the 70-80's dacor!

Honestly the best place I found to eat some classic breakfast in Chinatown. They have the classic dim sum, the classic letter breakfast specials A,B,C,D,E. Food gets here quick. Neighborhood service. Great customer service. Food never disappoints always consistent. It's cheap. Honestly one of the only traditional HK style breakfast places left in Chinatown with lots of seatings and gives you the HK vibe of a restaurant. The places is filled with photos of HK stars who have came here to eat so you know this place is legit. This place has what I believe is the best beef fun noodles, and iced coffee.
Fast and polite service and yummy congee.

Bland. Not your better place to go to for a quick bit. Orders was just warm and lucky me I order a noodle dish and they had to make it for me. I even made a statement that the sriracha sauce tasted like they mix ketchup in it to cut cost. Was not even spicy.

We loved the noodles and the fried rice. The dumplings were pretty awesome as well. The one thing we didn't like was the braised pork which just tasted like a wad of fat and bones. We would absolutely eat here again but we wouldn't order that pork. the service was friendly and it was the total NY Chinatown experience. The fried rice was probably the best I've ever had anywhere and I would have enjoyed the noodles more if it weren't for the aforementioned pork. Don't order the crullers/doughnuts though. They come dry with nothing to top them with. No frosting, no sugar, nothing to dip them in....just nothing. We left ours sitting on the table.

Noodle Village has been a staple of Chinatown for at least a 15yrs or more. I would really call it the second generation of restaurants that are part of Chinatown and still around because the food is great. I come quite often for soup dumplings. The skin is a translucent feel which is how it should be. Not that thick bouncy stuff. You can literally see the soup inside. A extra plus is that they credit card. Additionally I would say it's not as rude as other Chinese establishments that are diner style. I wouldn't say this is fine dining though

Their clay pot rice is definitely one of the best in the city (that I’ve tried). Brilliantly crispy bottom, plenty of ingredients on top, and a wonderful sauce to pour in. Order in advance because these take time (and for good reason because the end product is amazing). The curry brisket with rice noodles that comes in a clay pot is also delicious. Wonderful curry sauce, slightly crisped rice noodles — so good. Everything else here is also done pretty well. Not too amazing, but they have so many dishes.

HK milk tea is also decent here, a tiny bit more watery than some of my favorite places for milk tea. And, the shanghai soup dumplings are also not bad here. Skin could be better but overall decent.

One of my favorite places to eat in Chinatown. Service isn’t the kindest, but I’d rather them be efficient and quick anyways. 

The food is incredible. My favorite is the shrimp wanton noodle soup. Very delicious on a chilly day. The noodles are very snappy and the wontons are tasty. 

Definitely try the soup dumplings too! I don’t have much experience with soup dumplings besides from this place, but they’re delicious.

Mom's favorite noodle place. Came here on a Saturday with my mom, brother and his friend. The place was packed. We were quickly seated. Order two appetizers to share and each of us had our own noodle soup or pan fried noodle - all were delicious. Highly recommended.

Tasty hot dog buns served here. Take them to go, as there is limited seating. Line moves fast. They also have tons of Chinese desserts, sweets, and cakes. Everything is dirt cheap - looking forward to visiting again.
Delicious hot dog bun! I went in at 7 in the morning and enjoyed breakfast peacefully. I didn't see how crazy it gets in here but I believe it. Will come back again when I'm in the area.

Yummy :) so fresh. 
This shop made me come back on my last day in NY. Highly recommended. Staff are very very helpful.
Our favorite bakery in Chinatown. Pork buns and black bean curd buns are delicious, and their egg custard tarts are the best!

Ever want any type of Chinese pastry? Come here, and quick! This place is always packed and for good reason. The baked goods taste amazing, everything is fresh, and a trip here is always required by my family if we are ever in the area. You're missing out if you don't come here, seriously. I will say I don't love their cakes as much as their breads and such, but it isn't really a hindrance and I always want to come here. Seating is spotty as since it's always packed, finding a seat to sit down and enjoy your food probably won't happen. But that shouldn't be a reason for anyone to not come here.
I Enjoyed every morsel and so did my book club!  Great hospitality and service! Sorry there was no wine...😞

The food is always delicious and fresh. we always feel at home and usually have the same waitress who remembers all of what we want to order. We have been coming here for years. Nowhere else tastes as good and fresh. I can't remember a time we have gone there that was not fantastic. And we are here about 4 times a month ....maybe twice that. 😀
I loved it!!!  My mother and I went three times in three days while visiting my aunt over the holiday.  We will definitely be back next time we’re in town. 😋
Very yummy! Loved this place since childhood

This may have been the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. The crabmeat wontons were tasteless, the shrimp in the shrimp fried rice weren’t cooked all the way, I had to finish cooking them at home, they were literally translucent. The delivery guy wasn’t friendly at all, he was actually quite rude. Never giving them my business again.

These cheese cakes are out of this world. Ordered a strawberry cheese cake and a latte. No good. Had to have another. This time it was caramel. Absolute cheesecake heaven. I think i could have gone through the whole menu!! Definitely a great place to visit and eat. Just put the name of the eatery into the You Tube search and see how great this place is 😋😋😋

There are a lot of different varieties of cheesecakes and other desserts. I had the strawberry cheesecake which I would have to add is a lot “fluffier” in comparison to other cheesecakes including Juniors. 
I would recommend giving the cheesecake a try. 
Nice little shop.

I had been wanting to try Eileen's cheesecake ever since I saw on Food Network "Eileen's Special Cheesecake vs. Junior's" in 2011. I am disappointed to find that the cheesecakes are overpriced. What I was hoping to try was what I saw on tv - the simple but "generous" slice of cheesecake, not $4.50 for an "extremely tiny" cheesecake that is just 1/3 the size of a regular slice of cheesecake!

The taste is 5 star. My only problem with it is the pricing. Yes, it is still a little less expensive than cheesecakes at fine-dining restaurants. But, I adamantly believe that the pricing should reflect what it is - a walk-in bakery. I recommend shopping around Little Italy for more reasonably-priced cheesecakes (what Eileen's Cheesecake used to be before it became too famous).

I bought 20 different flavors, and gave some to 2 other friends. At the same time, I felt ripped off and thought, "I will never come back again". This is not the kind of impression I had hoped from Eileen's Cheesecake. I went in with high hopes of finding a cheesecake shop that I would want to revisit again and again, not a "tourist trap".

Amazing cheesecake!

We arrived to this cheesecake place by chance and decided to give it a try since the place looked packed. 

Both the plain cheesecake and the red velvet one looked good and tasted great. Would love portions to be a bit bigger but that is true for every good dessert I try 😉.

Highly recommend to visit this place.

Amazing cheesecakes here. I love that I could get a mini cheesecake. There are so many to just pick one. I went with the traditional strawberry cheesecake mini and it was very delicious! The staff was very nice and friendly!

My daughter is obsessed with high end pizza so I decided to take her to the very first pizza joint in America. It didn't disappoint one bit. The whole experience was outstanding. The crust was thin, crispy and delicious, the toppings were fresh and perfect and the service was outstanding. The ambiance was full little Italy. If you love pizza and you are visiting NY, you have got to eat here!

Very delicious thin pizzas in Soho!
 Portions are generous!
Great ambiance! 
Knowledgeable waiters!
Not cheap but this is New York (everything is expensive)!
Only inconvenience, they take CASH only!

This is probably the best pizza I have ever had. They have great service and a friendly staff. The 3 star rating is for two reasons. First, I ordered a twelve inch pizza with pepperoni only and it was $26 dollars. Even though it’s great pizza I think that’s a little steep. Second, once we ordered our pizzas it took 40 minutes to get it. I came in to the restaurant already super hungry so that was definitely a turn off. It’s wasn’t that busy as well but hey, sometimes  things happen that the customer doesn’t know so I guess it happens. Still the best pizza that I’ve had. Thanks for reading.

Loved the pizza. It has a great flavour and a very thin crust. Always add the ricotta your flavour palate will thank you. The only thing is I wish they added more cheese and less sauce. But that’s a personal preference!

Lombardi’s is the first pizzeria in the United States, as such, I was quite curious to try it out. I ordered two Margherita pizzas - one large pizza with olives and one medium with no toppings. After about 15 minutes, the pizzas arrived. The pizza itself was thin and everything looked great. 
Dough/Crust - 
The crust was crispy on the outside and moist and soft on the inside. The actual middle was soft and had a good bit of sauce soaking it. Parts of the crust were burnt a little too much and that did cause some of the flavor to be tainted but otherwise it was fine.
Sauce - 
The sauce was exceptional. The right amount of sweetness and tang were incorporated. Perfectly salted and had a great consistency, really brings the pizza together.
Cheese- 
The cheese was a bit disappointing.Mozzarella cheese was used on the pizza and simply was not quality. As I examined the cheese on my paper plate,  there was a rubbery texture that was off putting. Mozzarella is supposed to have some elasticity, but this cheese almost felt fake. Flavor was almost nonexistent and just brought the quality of the pizza down.

Lombardi's has great pizza. It would be almost perfect if the cheese was improved, otherwise, they check all the boxes and some more.

Really friendly and delicious Vietnamese restaurant in Chinatown and next to the Courthouse.  Can't go wrong with the soups on a cold day or a heading bowl of bun on a regular day.  Service is amazingly fast and friendly.  Good is simply delicious.
Food was very good, pricing was okay. Service was very fast, instantly waited on. All the food ordered arrived in about 4 minutes.
This is the only place I go for Pho. Their pork chop over rice is also awesome. Highly recommend.

Brilliant If you want a basic pho with a lot of flavours in it. 
Seating is pretty basic but it works for the setting. 
Staff is friendly and the food is fresh. Oh and it’s dirt cheap :)

Food here is really really good authentic and fresh, and service is attentive. Ordered the crepe which was huge, and so so good. Combo vermicelli was so good, with crispy egg rolls and BBQ pork. The banh khot (?) little cupcakes filled with shrimp and green onion and coconut flavor was great too. Price is on the high end for Vietnamese food, therefore minus a star. Will return tho, for the good food!

Dim sum is good. Very flavorful. The savory dishes are average. But the place is too tight as the restaurant is shaped like a long hallway. Constantly struggling to squeeze by especially during prime hours.

The food was fine.  Everyone LOVED the pork buns.  The dumplings and fried rice also good.  Fresh seafood you can see alive before you eat.  All good things.  But it’s not BYOB.  They charge a 30 dollar fee, a common occurrence at most restaurants when you bring your own but it’s called a corkage and means it’s not BYOB.  Still go.  But know you can’t just waltz in with a few bottles of your own for free.
Great sea food and great customer service!!!  We had brunch and enjoyed everything from Fresh spiny lobster to fish and chips. The Bellinis were also great!  No corkage fee either on wine we took.

Typical Chinese resto. Crowded, salty food, but delicious. This time, servers speak English. Table kept clean with disposable paper table cover. Restroom, not too dirty, and good fixture, but only 2 stalls for men's room. Not exactly the cheapest. And servers are friendlier than other places I have been to.

Eating dim sum at Ping was a positive experience. The food was tasty, and assembled with care. One point worth noting was the minimal oil in the food, where dim sum shops generally have too much. Unfortunately, the menu seemed limited in terms of variety compared to what I am used to seeing. Overall, Ping will certainly provide that 'dim sum' fix.

One of my favorite spots honestly. Sit by the window to get a good view of little Italy in live action. Always get Thai tea with the meal. Pretty good service, but the prices and flavor keep this one of my top spots. 😍😍
Such tasty food and quick service -- and really affordable! We had 9 people dining in and order 10-12 dishes and ate for under $120. Highly recommend!

Solid malaysian food serving a lot of mainstay and doing it very well. The salt fish fried rice is fantastic. The roasted chicken here is hands down some of the best anywhere. Crispy skin and never dry. Served with a savory soy and chicken broth sauce. I order takeout from here often and Nyonya never disappoints.

Great Malaysian food. Authentic and delicious and great value. Had guests over and picked this restaurant and it was even better then I remembered. Everyone had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed the dinner. Let the pics speak for themselves.

Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the entire city. One of the best places for real Malaysian food, and quality is simply excellent. I kid you not when I say no matter what dish you order on the menu you will enjoy it. Great decor inside and plenty of seating. Always a Go-To whenever I don't know what to eat!

This is the first place I come to when visiting new York. Excellent dim sum, including soup dumplings, but also a wide selection of vegetarian dumplings, duck, curried beef dim sum. Wide selection of dishes including delicious general tsos chicken, need with paper thin ginger, stir fried pea shoots, eggplant with pork and much more. Good condiments especially the ginger. Friendly and efficient staff. Clean but basic interiors.

A quiet spot on a Monday night, good for a group looking to reconnect. The food here is very good. The service is efficient. I would definitely come back here for a meal. Always with dim sum there is so much choice, was wishing I had more of an appetite to try more items. Beyond the dim sum the other dishes looked fantastic. Will come back.

This place never fails. The food here is always great and on point. It can get a bit crowded at times and occasionally you have to wait even with reservations, but that's the way it is when the food is good. They dont have the cars here but the food is really good. It's definitely my dim sum place of choice. It's definitely worth traveling to.

Being a frequent traveler to China, I don't eat much Chinese food when I'm in the US. But if friends insisted on getting Chinese in NYC, and if they want dim sum, here's where I take them. 

It's not your typical dim sum experience of a lot of chaos, shouting, push carts in the dinning room. You order off the menu, and the food is then prepared for you, as a result, the items are fresh, and their recipes are light and healthier. It's a much more pleasant experience. Though the con is that there is less selection from the bigger dim sum joints, and the dinning room gets very crowded, so be mentally prepared to be seated right next to strangers while you eat.
This is the place to come with a large group for dim sum - food comes out fast and it's easy to scale the order for however many people are in your party

First time there And I like the place a lot. The food is good, the place is great plus and something important for me, the bathrooms are clean. 
First you have to understand how the place works, if you are like me and don’t know about Dim Sum here is what Wikipedia says “Dim sum is a style of Chinese cuisine prepared as small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets or on a small plate. Dim sum dishes are usually served with tea and together form a full tea brunch”
Then,  in the restaurant you will see women around pushing tray carts with Dim Sum, or soup or desserts. You pick what you want to eat and they’ll put a mark in a piece of paper that the waitress is going to give it to you at the begging with your tea and chopsticks. Or you can pick something form the menu (by the way shrimp fried rice is delicious ). 
At the end of your meal you take the card to the cashier and pay for what you eat. Each mark on the paper has a value depending where is placed. Small, medium or large, or if you got something form  the menu or a drink that’s written on the back. 
The experience is awesome plus the food is great and the prices are reasonable. 
I loved the tea and the service.

Always a line to get in, but it goes quick. Once in, food is good. Try to sit by the kitchen to get fresher, hotter food. Or, grab your ticket and wait by the kitchen door. Either way, great place for an interesting lunch.

Good dum sum. Think its a very popular place. Its a huge banquet hall with round tables. My party of two had to share a big round table with another party of four. It was packed but not long wait for walk in.

Menu is different from the other location so be sure to check it before hand. The massive dining area and over the top decor is just outstanding. I loved the chandeliers. The food was good too. I was craving fried rice and that's how we ended up here. The Har Gao(w?) Was the BEST I EVER HAD IN NYC. As if they was seasoned with more than just salt. I ate all 4. A little on the pricey side but then food was tasty. Especially those ribs.

Great Dim Sum.  Some dishes are more flavorful than others.  Make sure to get there early on the weekend to get your number to go in as the lines near lunch time build up fast.  Multiple workers walk around with carts with a couple types of items per cart.  If you want it you take it and they mark off your card with what you took.
Cooper Union is like my home. I love it here!
Ok

Great experience excellent customer care they cater to me to the fullest and I kind of needed it I was having a rough day I just found a bit I just lost the bid on a job that was worth my half a million dollars and that he know tha

My aunt wanted me to take nursing and yet not help me pay for school. I truly appreciated my art Teacher Mr.Sierra for supporting my interests & boosts my system to pursue art school. High school for arts and business, they have connection about workshops for undergraduates or representing our high schools, I was the selective to present my high school. I truly enjoyed the workshops to be exposed in real world. Thank you for the opportunity to experienced to have a model and painting classes free for us in 1998-1999, ptf

Amazing school with a lot of opportunities. The professors are all incredible and they all want to be there. It is very easy to get the individual attention you need here because of the small classroom setting -- my calculus class has only about 20 people in it, and my class in ancient poetry has only 9. It is a great fusion of artists, architects and engineers from all over the world. There are plenty of opportunities to explore your abilities not only in your field, but also any science you're interested in, such as synthetic biology and students are allowed to take classes in other schools - an engineer can take a class in drawing or calligraphy, and an architect is welcome to study chemistry. Truly an incredible place.

This is one of my favorite churches in town. I love the gothic look and I absolutely adore the garden. Right now they have daffodils flower and the magnolia is blooming. Luckily for us the gate to the garden was open so we went it to explore. Live video is available on my Facebook page 🔥
A Great Place To Pray.  Very Beautiful Inside And Out.  Must Be Visited!
I love this place it’s like school but better
What a beautiful place with amazing architecture!

This French Gothic Revival church is one of the most astonishing in Manhattan. The surrounding landscape is one of a kind, giving the whole site and the school a sense of a European campus. I was lucky to find it open one day, so I took the opportunity. You have to know the schedule so don’t come without checking online first.

Right in the heart of Alphabet City this place is great for watching dogs play in the large and busy dog park. It's located near some of the best nightlife in NYC and is great place to smoke a joint with friends 👍. 

They have basketball courts that are always being used, also cool to watch.

It does get a little creepy at night and the homeless people at night can get intimidating for people not used to the city.

Many films and TV shows film here, Russian Dolls on Netflix takes place all around the neighborhood and much of it happens in the park. 👍😉
Amazing park. Always a ton of stuff going on. Fun to see the NYU students filming. Also, great playgrounds for kids.

Tompkins isn't Central Park-- however, it's clean and if you have a "pup" the dog park is wonderful!  Tompkins isn't a HUGE (park) nor does it have the landmark Arch like Washington Sq.(SoHo) but for me... I enjoy it a whole lot better! Hope this was helpful.
Beautiful park in the city.  The farmer's market was amazing.  Good place to go to unwind a bit in the midst of the city madness.

Tompkins Square Park is a nice little neighborhood spot to visit, especially on a good weather Sunday. Parents gather with kids to play on the playground; dog lovers hit the dog park area with thier pups; there's a concrete area used for a variety of sports like floor hockey, and in the heat of summer, you'll find folks lounging on the grass.

Personally, I enjoy the Sunday farmer's market. They are best mid spring too late fall, but open year round, and accept EBT. There's also a place at the market where you can compost food scraps and donate clothing to help the planet a bit. 

Not what I'd call a tourist destination, but certainly a cozy spot for locals to enjoy a slice of nature and neighbors.

This place is a hole in the wall that is easy to miss if you don't know it's there. However this place should not be missed. The reason it got its name is because of the coffee it serves. The coffee is great and so is that atmosphere. The staff is quick and happy to help. This is a great place for a quick coffee, before hitting the bars.

This coffee place is like a hidden gem. When you first enter it looks like there’s not much space to sit but as you walk further there is plenty of seats and it has quite a romantic nice feel. The waiters were super fun and I had the banana bread dessert with tea which were to die for

MUD is exactly what you want it to be. You're told your going to a cool breakfast spot and you think "Yea sure I know what a diner is like". Well, you're gonna be pleasantly wrong about this one. Great coffee, great espresso, great ambiance. The back dining area is my favorite.

What a phenomenal brunch spot. The decor is marvelously eclectic yet purposeful and the brunch deal was fantastic. $21 for a beer/mimosa, coffee, and one of their most popular brunch entrees. I left very full and happy.

Mud has an incredibly comfy, cozy vibe with an eclectic decor and is perfect for meeting a friend for coffee or a meal.

The food was great as was the service. My crew had the burrito, NYC breakfast and the almond, fruit pancake. All were delicious with filling portion sizes. 

I highly recommend it!

First time trying out Ukrainian. The only other Eastern European cuisine that I've tried previously was Polish, and the two weren't too far off. Unfortunately, As I wasn't too familiar with the language, and the names of the foods, I can't give good recommendations.
One thing that I did notice, though was that Ukrainian food seemed to be less sour compared to Polish.
The place is located deep inside the building, so be sure to walk all the way in. It's right next to a bigger Ukrainian restaurant that has a slightly better rating, but I can't imagine it being too different, taste wise.
Delicious Ukrainian food in a church basement-like setting. I don’t think you can get a more authentic experience anywhere outside of Ukraine. One of my favorite restaurants.
Excellent Eastern European specialities. The experience took me back to my grandmother's home and her outstanding Polish cooking. Would definitely revisit this restaurant.
Great old school Ukrainian restaurant! There is only one waitress usually so be prepared to wait a little. The food is fantastic though so just have a little patience.
Delicious authentically ethnic food.  Borscht is fantastic.  Fast, hot, and smells divine.   Quaint and cozy dining room.  A real dining experience.  We'll be back.

This place is always great! Good food, good atmosphere, great prices. It's pretty much home cooking for me but it really holds its own. I've come here several times and brought company--everyone really enjoys it. It gets crowded and lively, but that's part of the charm.

Eggs Benedict was really good. Gets very busy weekend mornings into early afternoon due to the brunch crowds and so it's pretty loud inside. Fast service and they compost scraps which I think is great.

I have been coming to Veselka for more than 15 years.  It is like comfort food in NYC.  It was a sunny March Sunday brunch.  We had to wait, but luckily the sun was shining on the other side of the street so we grabbed a Mud coffee and used a grate for our "coffee table".  I had the borscht and cabbage rolls.  Yum.
Very good place and it's super authentic. The service  is fast and efficient. And the prices are absolutely reasonable. So I highly recommend this to anyone looking for authentic Russian.

Late night dinner here is always a treat. Salads made fresh and always well balanced. Many healthy options. Vegetarian options are a breath of fresh air. Hard I find this elsewhere. They also dress up the diner for all holidays. Very comfy setting. Some patrons can be a bit loud, drunk, or  annoying late at night as many come out of the local bar woodwork.

Deserts are a must.

It’s one of the places that represents the vibe of St. Marks Place the greatest. It’s bustling with full of lively voices while offering street-style menus. Their foods are not the healthiest quite frankly but you wouldn’t make that an issue since it’s not the main purpose of going to this place. Definitely worth checking out.
Very fun old-school izakaya that has been here forever. I love this place! Food is good, and it's just a good time.
Loved this place. Got some delicious food after midnight after hearing about it from a friend. It's my new late night spot

Great place for late night feast. A or B Set + one dish is awesome and plenty of food for 2 people. Salmon Yakisoba Noodles is one of their signature dishes and awesome. Asparagus with bacon wrapped skewers and the Spicy Tonoksu is killer when it's cold out. Seating isn't the greatest as it's little stools with little tables, unless you're with a group of 4-5 to get big table.
Nostalgic izakaya that has been on St Marks forever. Tasty food, pitchers or beer, always a good time.

Bruno Pizza has excellent pizza and wine choices. The wine list with the owner’s tasting notes was a wonderful touch and I was excited I got to try something new and funky. The pizza was delicious- we could taste the quality ingredients. The atmosphere was nice and our server was very attentive. It is a little pricey but I think that is pretty standard in NYC. I also appreciate the no-tipping movement and I hope people will support that by enjoying a meal here.

In town for the weekend, ordered a few pies to go. At the house we had a cheese, a pepperoni, and sausage & onions. 
Pretty tasty stuff. Crust had a decent snap, yet a little thick. 
Next time I’m in town, try it fresh at the shop?

The service was good, but the food was bland and the seating was uncomfortable.

I got a NYC styled cheese pizza. The dough was soft and chewy which was interesting, but it was borderline tasteless. The charred/burnt areas of the dough overpowered any taste that the pizza had unfortunately.

I wanted to like the pizza because of the texture of the dough, but it was just not tasty. My friend had the same opinion with a different pizza.  I'm not sure where all these other rave reviews came from, but this is no 4.6 star place.

I'd give 3 stars for decent service and the fact it's no-tipping.
One star for the food and seating.
Damian makes an excellent pizza with the best ingredients and the experience of a true artisan. Great wine offerings to compliment all varieties of food served. Delightful. Thanks
Great authentic pizza with homemade organic dough. Nice wine list as well. No tip policy is a nice touch. Give it a try.
Food is tasty and generally fresh. Not as many vegetarian options as they used to have but you'll get by. Try the house special sauce on the arepas to take them to the next level.

The food is ok taste wise but way over priced. Plus, the manager was rude when I came in. The place was empty, he wanted me to stay at the bar instead of sitting at a table, waiting for my two girlfriends. He said we never know they might not show up when I guaranteed him that first I will order food before they arrive so I will be using the table genuinely, and second that they are very close to being there. I will probably would not go back.
A tiny, quaint space with great food and friendly staff. We sat right by the open kitchen which made the experience even more interesting.
Omg. Sooo good!!! Everything was fresh and quick!!! Small place but they move people in and out quickly.
Yum! Best arepas around. Good portions a d the price is great!

Hot Kitchen has flavorful Szechuan food with very fragrant spices, though a tad salty, but this location has awful service in person and on the phone. We would call and they would hang up in the middle of an order. The Midtown location is much better.
Good place for small party

Quite expensive, but a very tasty place to grab some Chinese food when the mood strikes.  Some great bars around here too, so if you have to wait for a table (it's very popular!), you can wait in comfort.

Ownership changed and menu changed. They do bbq and hotpot now and most reviews goes to old ownership. I bet you can’t find their new menu price online now, as they are small quantities and expensive. I don’t recommend going this place if you are not from rich government families in Sichuan. Not worth the price and too spicy for most people with food not fresh.

BRING MICROSCOPE! CAREFUL ABOUT THE FOOD!!!
Disappointed in their excellent negligence and denyability. Food taste great, but I hate their negative attitude.
There's a very hard spice, poppy seed I believe. I chewed it, unfortunately cracked my tooth. It hurts. So I finished up quickly. When I was asking for the check I was asking if I could return the untouched food due to my tooth tragedy. Thanks to my company I have a great dental care. So I wasn't asking for anything like money/reimbursement(you name it). And to be honest I totally understand if they just say it can't be returned in order to be responsible for other customers. All I intended to do is tell them to be more careful prepping the food next time. BUT, look what I got. The server just get a similar spice, crushing it hardly with his thumb and said "look even my thumb can do the job, it's not our problem...you're probably faking it for return the untouched food" excuse me? it's just couple bucks of food and I'm sacrificing my tooth and my way much expensive dental deductible?🙄 Fine, let me show you my pain. so I went to the restroom, took a picture with the help of the mirror. I showed him the picture indicating it's a fresh crack and you may get a "phantom pain" through the picture. It really hurts. Still, they don't care, they said it's my problem that my tooth is too fragile??? 🙄🙄🙄I felt disrespected and assaulted. Maybe I should bring the lawsuit or FDA guy to teach them a lesson.
Won't come back again.

Tucked away, this is definitely an Italian gem.  Casual overall with old school charm.  Check out the massive eternal candles in the back and ask the staff about it - there is a whole story behind them.   Nice wine selection.   Food is solid and some standard Italian classics.  The Diners, Drive Ins and Dives dish is very good.  Homemade pastas.  Will walk out of there full!  Staff was great and attentive.

Clams were chewy in my linguine w white clam sauce. If I had seen the dish before ordering, I would have avoided ordering it - as soon as it came out, and I saw the size of the clams, I knew the clams would be chewy. Otherwise, good food. Spedieni was particularly good, as were the meatballs.
Classic Italian in one of the oldest Italian restaurants in Manhattan. Friendly service. Full vegan menu as well as regular.

Good ambience. Service and food do not come close to the hype. Meatball sauce was nice but the meatballs themselves were nothing special. I've had chicken parm and other Neapolitan cuisine from local mom and pop shops of much better quality.

Had the most positive experience at John’s last night. Fun, convivial atmosphere, top-notch service, and delicious food - it would be easy for an institution like this to rest on its laurels, but the food is fantastic. The chef and kitchen staff are obviously very dedicated and creative.  The chicken parmigiana is the real deal. And save room for the tiramisu! Will definitely be back - I want to be a part of the John’s family!

Delicious food and great cocktails! Service was interesting as they were almost a little too fast and attentive. It felt like we were being rushed out a bit. 
All the below were great! 

Pork buns
Rice cakes- I would come back for this over and over 
Ribs- very tender and great sauce 
Burrata curry
Food was very delicious and presentation was superb. A bit pricey but not overwhelming. Would definitely recommend it for special occasions or if you just need a nice night out to eat.

The flatiron was the standout. The steak was cooked perfectly. 

However, I wish they had not poured the garlic pepper sauce around it. It all happened a bit too quickly, I think the server asked but I didn’t realise how much sauce would be poured into the plate. And I thought the sauce was not a good complement. It tasted like raw cream and not much else. Too much of it created a weird Alfredo like pool in the plate.

I also ordered a small plate of fried something. That dish was so forgettable that I have already forgotten what I got, 12 hours ago.

Woah, do you like spicy? Or ham? This is your spot. So incredibly tasty and so many delicious flavors all together. Get the cauliflower side dish, it's amazing- my favorite thing there.
