The ham selection is fantastic and perfectly prepared. I wasn't that excited about eating here but once I had a taste I was sold. Already looking forward to another great lunch. Also, the staff was so friendly and kind, It made the experience even better.

Good but not WOW

I fell in love with the pork buns years ago. I should have taken those today too. We had the two best sellers; duck and chicken. Good but not excellent. I had better tasting food at Uncle Boons yesterday. I don’t see that one mentioned by the food critics. Google however gives 4,6 to that one and 4,4 to this. People know. I will however come and taste the buns one more time.
One of the best Japanese restaurant I’ve been so far. Goof prices and unbelievable authentic vibes. It feels like you are not even in NYC. Highly recommend.

Great hot Wakame noodle bowl but service was slow, they brought the wrong beer and never checked in on us. They we're not busy. Still, the company was great, the table was comfy. It was good. I'd go back.

I've been coming here for 20+years and the cozy Japanese home cooking hasn't changed. To be able to keep the high quality service and cooking all these years is worth all the stars and the return visits.  Their seasonal menu is important to try since so much of Japanese cuisine is about the seasons.
I got the hot soba noodles with tempura and it was delicious! It was a really nice place with great service. I sat alone at the bar so I was attended to very quickly.

Lived in NYC 10yrs ago. Sobaya is the only thing I dream/fantasize about. The soba broth is incredible and the daily veggie is always a treat. Have looked high and low for this combo, not to be found anywhere else. Oh, and homemade soba is simply the best.
Wonderful service. Fantastic flavors. Great wine. Lovely setting.
Amazing Japanese experience. All the courses are delicious, I highly recommend. 4/5 stars+
Service is excellent, the food is amazing. Really enjoy the rice on a pot. always looking forward to see the new fall and winter menu. The dishes looks like art.
Excellent tasting menu and very knowledgeable staff
Disappointed in their choice to no longer offer a la carte dining, which I was a fan of - not every good story is a novel (and not every novel is a good story).

Delicious food and great cocktails! Service was interesting as they were almost a little too fast and attentive. It felt like we were being rushed out a bit. 
All the below were great! 

Pork buns
Rice cakes- I would come back for this over and over 
Ribs- very tender and great sauce 
Burrata curry

I had better tasting food at Uncle Boons yesterday. I don’t see that one mentioned by the food critics. Google however gives 4,6 to that one and 4,4 to this. People know. I will however come and taste the buns one more time.
Address needs update went to the old building had to walk a halve of an hour to get to the correct address, try phoning or WEB, it works out better unless you have an appointment!  Lots of security!

On June 03 2018 about 2:00 pm.

While I am sitting down on the chairs in the park and using google to learn about The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Tower

 colloquially known as the Met Life Tower, is a landmark skyscraper, built in 1909 and located on Madison Avenue near the intersection with East 23rd Street, across from Madison Square Park in Manhattan, New York City. Designed by the architectural firm of Napoleon LeBrun & Sons and built by the Hedden Construction Company, the tower is modeled after the Campanile in Venice, Italy.[7] The hotel located in the clock tower portion of the building has the address 5 Madison Avenue, while the office building covering the rest of the block, occupied primarily by Credit Suisse, is referred to as 1 Madison Avenue.

As we could see the clock tower from our hotel room ( Cambria Chelsea on 28th ) we felt we ought to see the rest of the building up close , its an impressive tower seen from Madison Sq and the Flatiron although its still a private building so we didnt go inside.
Terrible place to work contract!

I️ had METLIFE auto coverage for a year.
They charged me 6000.00 for a year of coverage.
Called to see what could be done when I️ Next month in regards to getting a cheaper rate and the rep told me that since Texas was hit so hard during the natural disaster that my rates would not be discounted and would possibly go up.

Fortunately I️ was not effected by Harvey and didn’t file any claims for the year. I️ said just that and his response was “ the company paying out to much money to cut you a deal” ...

I paid the 800.00 he asked for to have coverage until my March 22 expiration... that would give me time until I️ found other insurance. 

Well today these bastards sent me a bill for 773.00. And said they were sorry the rep didn’t do his job fully but he should have quoted me 1600.00 

DO NOT EVER USE METLIFE FOR ANYTHING!!!!!!

They price gouge. I️ will also be filing a TDI complaint.

Great selection of shops, places for food and the cinema. Toilets in good condition, including family rooms for those with more demanding needs. Train station on the one side, bus station on the other. Comfortable 10 min stroll into the centre of Aberdeen.

Just a shopping mall with loads of chain stores. There is nothing distinctive about this place to make it particularly pertinent to Aberdeen.
That is not to say the shops or restaurants are poor quality. It's just that they could be anywhere in the UK.

Good clean shopping mall, good shops and restaurants. Enjoyed the cinema and the popcorn. The fact that you can bring a beer into the cinema is really good! The mall is clean and well maintained with stalls on Saturday that makes it a bit different. The bus and train station are there too which makes it comfortable
The shops are good, but there simply aren't enough of them. Union Square should have another level. 3 rather than 2 would've provided enough shops to cater for all.

It's a great place to go if you like to queue. You queue to get in. You queue to park your car. You queue to pay in the shops. You queue to get something to eat. You queue to pay for the pleasure of queuing. Then guess what when you want to leave, you have to queue.

Was at the bar on the weekend.. Had to wait a bit to be accommodated. The staff was very polite and service of the place is amazing. The cocktails were mind blowing. I Would specially recommend the Chocolate cocktail.

Tried a couple of appetizers which were great as expected from a place of such standards. Hope to back soon to try the main course.

A well deserved Michelin three star establishment. You can see chef's innovations in the food. Every dish I had here met my expectations if not surpassed it. I would recommend it to every friend. This restaurant is truly worth a trip for. 

The decor here is simple but elegant. Service is warm and attentive. Plenty of time were given among dishes allowing ample time to mingle at the table. You would get a candy bar if you put your phone in the box. Very interesting.
Such a beautiful and special place. Since I am vegetarian they did their best to accommodate me. The food was delicious and the presentation was very nice. An absolute must for a special occasion.

Unbelievable. Will beat any food you've ever tried. It's so well co-ordinated. From the staff who welcome you in, the food and the goodbye. Everything about this place will have you wanting to come back for more. Thank you for a truly amazing night.

Perfection served on a plate. An intimately intricate production on every dimension. All aspects of the food and service are carefully curated at the pinnacle of excellence, which will surprise and delight your senses from the beginning to the end of your experience. A restaurant that truly lives by its values (proudly posted in the immaculate kitchen), which you can taste with every bite. A+

A very friendly welcome and excellent service throughout. 
Plenty of space between tables with all the usual condiments to hand.
A great menu with choices like Baby Back Ribs $21, Chopped Pork Shoulder $18, Turkey Pastrami $17 and Barbecue Salmon $22.
Sides to include Mac & Cheese $14, Pork & Beans $10 and Side Salad $9.
We chose the 'Cue Classic' at $45pp.
This included Baby Back Ribs, Dry Rubbed Chicken, Smoked Sausage, Chopped Pork Shoulder, Beef Brisket, Every Side, Pickles, Jalapenos and Biscuits. 
The four of us devoured every mouthful!
Superb tasting food with the meat just melting away in our mouth. A really good smokey flavour. 
Washed down with a pitcher of beer, it was an excellent dinner. 
We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

I heard of this place when I went to Good Morning America for a taping. I took myself to Blue Smoke as a solo date and on a Friday night and it was one of the best experiences that I’ve had in a while. The hospitality and waiters were top notch. The timeliness of the food was spot on. I ordered the fried chicken with collards. The cornbread is delicious. The beignets are the best thing outside of New Orleans. On my second trip, I tried the brisket and ordered a craft ginger ale and had a waffle. Tender, juicy, and flavor filled. I will definitely be coming back. And the Battery Park location is stunning in the summertime. Great food there as well. Decor gives you a nice, down home, barbecue feel.
Fantastic family style BBQ place. Restaurant is huge, so plenty of seating and kid friendly. Love that it's a No Tipping restaurant. Prices were still reasonable and service was excellent.

Smoke has a new way of dining for lunch. You place the order at the front, find your own seat and get your own food when it's ready. Very weird! When I go to a restaurant, I liked to be served and I'm willing to pay for it.
The food is not that great to stop me from going somewhere else to be served. I might as well have went to a buffet style restaurant.
 I've always enjoyed Blue Smoke.
Sad! I'll be back when you have waiters and waitresses back for lunch!

This is our family favorite smoke house in NYC
It have its own style of smoke, with white oak wood, and 2 signatures sauces; one champagne vinegar based and one is smoked tomato based.
Seasonal menu changes are subtle,
Family style service and individual plate service are available, as well as extensive bar and balcony seating.
And this is a NO TIP restaurant, meaning they care for their employees, and the service is GREAT!!

A very friendly welcome and excellent service throughout. 
Plenty of space between tables with all the usual condiments to hand.
A great menu with choices like Baby Back Ribs $21, Chopped Pork Shoulder $18, Turkey Pastrami $17 and Barbecue Salmon $22.

Washed down with a pitcher of beer, it was an excellent dinner. 
We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

And this is a NO TIP restaurant, meaning they care for their employees, and the service is GREAT!!

One of best bars in New York. The staff is really friendly. The quality of the food is really good as well. I came here for some drinks and snacks. I was not disappointed, one of my favorite was the crab and artichoke dip. Awesome food, great environment. Highly recommended, thank you guys.

Fish sandwich was delicious. The cod was fresh and fried to perfection and seasoned perfectly. The staff was attentive and very polite. The bartender even gave us a free drink when he was trying to create new cocktails. He made something and asked us to try it and see what we think and when we told him that we liked it, he gave us the drink for free! Highly recommend.

My experience here wasn't good or bad. I stopped in for a quick bite and a drink after work with a friend. The food was ok. The drinks were decent but nothing spectacular. Maybe if their prices were just a bit better I'd give them a better rating. There are nicer places with better food and drinks in the area which are not as expensive. Check them out for yourself.
One of my favorite places to dine and hang out. Staff is amazing and service is great. Everytime I've gone with friends and family we've always had a great time

Another great NYC restaurant!  Food is excellent. They continue the specialties of a well-known chef. The staff is amazing!  
It’s on my Fav list!

Casual and authentic South Indian restaurant. Famous chain that started in India with locations around the world. All vegetarian and full of flavor. Went with someone more familiar with the cuisine which was very helpful.

Food quality is good.  But please note THE BILL CONSISTS OF 15% GRATUITY.  In CC receipt, again you can find TIP column.  I simply added 10% TIP and put my signature.  Means, I ended up paying 25% towards TIP.  I strongly feel this is not a good practice by Saravana Bhavan,  I suggest, customers  need to look into the detailed bill before they add TIP.
Great South Indian vegetarian food. Simple setting, but clean and fast. On the spicy side for those who are not used to it.

Delicious and authentic South Indian vegetarian food. A wide range of  breads, doughs and pastries serves with a variety of flavoured sauces. Great Indian comfort food! Also highly recommend trying the traditional Indian filter coffee - served with a bowl and a cup so you can pour it to cool it down.

Have visited several times. There was this one time where we had a very slow serving experience and the waiters did not give a proper reason for delay. Nevertheless it’s an excellent hotel and they maintain a good supply chain world wide.

Really liked the ambiance of this place. Though it's not in the theater district we went there before seeing a show. They asked if we were going to the theater and assured us we would be out in plenty of time. Even pointed us to the best subway station. Our group shared a large simple salad which was very fresh and delicious. We each had a different pasta dish and liked them all. Service was spot on. Will definitely be back.

Yum yum yum yum the food. I took some work colleagues here to celebrate a great customer deliverable and no regrets.  We couldn't get a reservation so we put our name on the list and went across the street to the watering hole to wait 45 min for our table.

It seemed as though spots at the bar are able to be reserved.  The food was delicious. Certainly one of those places you can fill up on the bread, soft and crusty.

Got the steak for two. It's a hearty portion with the sides, but if you have two hearty and hungry gentleman and can be easily consumed by 2.

Walking around it seemed like there was a lot of dates going on. So if you need a home run date place, go here. But watch out, plenty of attractive people there and you or your date's head might be swiveling!

This is an amazing restaurant in every sense of the word. Danny Meter really delivers on this gorgeous space, quality staff, and delicious daily menu. The prix fixe option is a great deal and this is a non-tipping restaurant so what you see is what you'll pay. Honestly, this was one of the finest dining experiences I've had in a very long time.
Cute and amazing date idea. Well worth the price! The servers here are phenomenal and attentive, the decor is cozy. It's fancy but not too fancy. I went for brunch and had a great time

Have loved this place for a long time, but this was my first visit to the new location. It is just as gorgeous as the old spot, but with more space. Had a delicious salad, phenomenal steak sandwich, and the honey roasted carrots were fantastic. Service was top notch and very friendly. While it definitely is expensive, it is on par with NYC prices and this is as good as it gets, so I'd consider it good value in that context. Perfect for special occasions or when you just want an exceptional meal.

I'm not a client or member of NYU 
They do have plumbing issues future NASA scientists can't figure out. 
Yes water flows down grade 😆
I'm enjoying a nice coffee and breakfast💪😎

New York University, referred to as "NYU", is a world-renowned private comprehensive research university located in New York, founded in 1831. The University of New York, consisting of 18 colleges and research institutes, has become one of the largest private non-profit higher education institutions in the United States and the only privately-owned school in the heart of New York.

New York University is a private research university spread throughout the world. Founded in 1831. This beautiful University situated in the heart of the New York city. In 2018, NYU was ranked amongst the top 30 universities internationally.
It is a wonderful college I attended for four years and I loved it.
I’m going for the Music Memory Competition soon! So excited ! ❤️

Tucked away in the heart of Greenwich Village, Grove Court is a beautiful historic residence. The red brick walkway and facade of the townhouses bring you back into time. I got a chance to tour one of the units, they are very quaint and it reminded me of a real life dollhouse.
It looks lovely from the outside, but it is not possible to visit
My absolute favorite apartments in that area. I stumbled upon them walking home from work and would check in on them regularly. There just lovely.

Yes, I stumbled upon this while long-boarding and geocaching right at dusk. The little row house windows were alight, I could imagine it looking much the same in the 1870s or 80s when these were probably built. Looking forward to trying out the nearby little owl restaurant at some point too.
Private courtyard. Not a park. No I have not been in there. Plucky row house owners!

Pretty good overall, food and service was terrific.  They had a spectacular selection of wine and whiskey.  I was ever so mildly disappointed with the seating arrangement and the bathrooms. It could have been a bit better given the price point.  I would definitely go back.
The Tripe appetizer was SUPERB! Our waiter James was very knowledgeable about the food and the preparation. He chose our wine and it went perfect with our meals. When in NYC again, I WILL go back!

Why not 5 stars?
This was our first time to dine at Babbo.

The menu was very impressively innovative.

The food was perfectly prepared and tasted great. We had the swordfish, linguine with clams and the squab, plus, a shared dessert.

The service was exceptional. Smooth. Charming. Attentive.

So, why not 5 stars? The audio environment. 

Babbo is famous for playing a rock ‘n roll soundtrack, but they play it too loud to have a civilized conversation with your tablemates. We asked for it to be lowered and they complied . . . for about 5 minutes . . . and then returned it to the higher level.

One of the finest dining experience in the land. The beef cheek ravioli, sweet breads, the tripe are extraordinary. The serve a barrel aged negroni that is exceptional. The best wine program in the city. You can't get a bad bottle no matter the price. I prefer sitting by the kitchen downstairs where I can sit side by side with my partner.

Was there for a friend's birthday. We all participated in the pasta tasting and everything was delicious! Servers were all super attentive in filling waters before they were even half empty and cleaning the table after each dish and providing new silverware each time although I found it unnecessary as we were going through so many dishes. We also got to try each dessert as well. Bill was definitely expensive but nice to try once for the experience.

Joe's Pizza is a fast place to get some of the tastiest pizza. You go in and a guy immediately asks you what you want. They have either cheese or pepperoni that has been hand created and cooked inside a brick oven. Well, there's the huge slice and then there's the whole pie, which is enormous. It smells and tastes amazing. There are bottled drinks from water to juice to soda. Slices are slid onto a paper plate and you either stand at a counter or stand outside to eat. Very small space inside, so we stood outside. It was very good pizza and quick service. I can't wait to eat there again.

Yummy pizza by the slice. I thought it was great but I have been deprived of pizza for a while so I'm sure anything would have done. My husband thought it was good but not what it was hyped up to be. If we are in the area we will be back but it would not be worth a special trip. The pizza was large New York style. They have a few varieties to choose from or you can order a whole pie to go.

Perfect NY slice! The crust is great, it is not too thin and allows you to taste the sauce and the cheese without being overwhelmed by the bread. The sauce is the perfect amount of sweet and pairs great with the cheese. Absolutely great for a snack.

Tip: they only take cash, but have an ATM in front. It does charge a fee, though.

Best pizza ever,  especially the Manhattan location. The other location did not have all the variety. We ate there 4 times on a 5 days trip, that's how good it is. Authentic New York style pizza. A must have!

Joe's is the best pizza slice in New York City or State.  Crispy crust, tangy sauce and perfect cheese. The ONLY reason I don't give it 5 stars is it is very crowded, very small and it is a tourist spot where tours stop by with 16 people or more milling in & out.
The best prosciutto in NYC! Highly recommend pasta with cheese and pepper and gnocchi with sausage. Didn’t really like broccoli and pasta with clams. Great wine selection!

YUM! I loved this place. Pasta is my all time favorite food, and this place did not disappoint. Service was great as well. I will say the food is filling and you probably don't need as much as you think. We ordered a ton and ended up getting so full before the final 2 dishes came out. Honestly we had forgotten that we even ordered the last 2 dishes, and when they came we we're like OMG we cannot finish this no way. Delicious food, good portion, great service. I definitely recommend!

After a terrible experience around the corner at Shuka, we found a seat at the bar here. Our Negronis were as good as it gets (excellent glassware as well). The pasta was wonderful and the service was perfect. The only complaint I had was a very over-dressed escarole salad, but the overall experience was more than good enough to bring us back again.

Great food. Waiters know what they're talking about, and if not sure they're honest and check it for you. 
Portions are a little bit too big maybe.
Great place that's off the beaten path. The waiter was very helpful with suggesting things from the menu. The food was exceptional and the drinks were crafted beautifully. I would definitely go back.

YOU HAVE TO COME HERE!
There is a huge variety of Bagels, sandwiches and cream cheese spreads. There is something here for everyone. If there's a line it's worth waiting in because everyone is here for the same reason as you- to try an amazing NY Bagel!
Ours was so good we didn't even get a chance to snap a picture before it was gone. Price was a little on the high side (especially for a sandwich) but for a little more than a Starbucks bagel price you could have the real deal with a Murray bagel.
Absolutely delicious bagels! The wait was not the long for a weekend and they are pretty fast getting orders ready. I got a salt bagel with cream cheese. So fresh and yummy.

Need a breakfast fix? Murray's is the place to go. Amazing bagels, tons of options, and quick service. Prices are pretty standard here, not a lot of seating, but worth the trip in to try a bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel.
Really good bagels and a longtime favorite for people in the neighborhood. Also has a fun and quirky selection of snacks and desserts. Try to avoid the lunch rush.

The bagels themselves are great, but don't get the fish here. The whitefish salad tasted a little off to me, the lox was rubbery, and the tuna salad is straight-up a can of Bumblebee — nothing remotely salad-like — crammed into a bagel. If you're gonna pay this much for a bagel in Manhattan, try Russ or Zabar's instead!

Great little pizza place in the area. We stopped for a couple of slices and it was delicious. 

Prices are very accessible without compromising flavor. 

It was very cold outside but they have the place heated, so it was comfortable and cozy inside. 

Recommended before or after hitting the bars.

I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE 10/5 STARS. 

To be honest, we walked in the place and was like: “whoa, this is... different,” And almost walked out. I’m so happy we didn’t. $1 for a cheese slice?! What could be better than that?! 

I ended up ordering 2 slices of pepperoni and my mother ordered 1 piece of cheese and 1 pepperoni, so we ate for $7 total. Those $2 slices of pepperoni ARE THE BEST PIZZA IVE EVER HAD. 

Whenever you’re in Greenwich, GO TO PERCY’S, YOU WON’T REGRET IT!!!!

Best $1 pizza in Manhattan. No contest. I'm sure the other pizzas are great, but I've never had anything other than the $1 cheese slices, and I've had a lot of them. The shop is fast and always has fresh pizza. The staff are pretty nice, for nyc pizza shops, and work hard. 
Be careful though, the shop is very small and they only take cash!
BEST pizza ever! Brought my mom here when she was visiting the city and she didn’t believe me that this was the best pizza In NYC! Now we go out of our way just to come here
This is $1 thin crust pizza. So crisp and firm. So tasty. They're very friendly. Try the Sicilian.

Amazing service and delicious food! Yes it can be expensive but it totally worth it for a nice dinner date or night out! Strongly recommend strip house potatoes and the ny strip. The chocolate cake was also mouthwatering. Our waitress was great and the manager Daniel is very kind. Definitely a must when you visit Las Vegas.

Been to quite a few steak houses and this one can compete with all the top ones. Steak is of course not cheap but the prices were reasonable. Calamari was to die for. Also had the duck fat potatoes as a side which was quite tasty. The full staff was great. Everyone seemed to be pitching in.

Fantastic steak with the sides we got mac and cheese and asparagus; so delightful! We loved the old vintage photos decorating the inside.  The wait staff did a fantastic job anticipating our needs and we wanted for nothing!
Would have to be the best meal I have ever had. The filet minion was the amazing, service was great and not super expensive. Given it was about $65 for a meal, still worth the price.

Been here on multiple occasions now and both the food has been excellent. Rib eye 20 oz bone in and half dozen oysters are out of this world. Decor and ambiance is great. Service up to par. Pricey but worth every penny.

Absolutely gorgeous treasure of a museum, up on a lovely little hill overlooking a quieter pay off town. One of the most peaceful places I've even been to, especially after the bustle of the usual Manhattan attractions. Your Met ticket is good here too, and they give you three days to make it both and a third location.

The space itself is wonderful, and the art is wonderful as well. I adored the tapestries, especially the room with a set telling the tale of a unicorn. There are some gorgeous relics and pieces of glasswork and more. Just wonderful.

We decided to visit here because the Met entrance stickers are good for three days at all of their museums and we thought we'd try this out. A quick ride on the express A train got us most of the way there and wow were we surprised. The quietest place we'd been in New York and a welcome repreve after a few loud days. There's nifty religious bits, but the courtyard was the best part. We say and watched snow melt off the roof from the warmth inside with plants and sunshine for probably two hours. Absolutely b beautiful.

It was beautiful! I recommend wearing comfortable shoes because you’re going to be doing a lot of walking. Also, they do not allow flash photography so make sure that you turn off flash when taking pictures.

Really awesome museum tucked away in an old monastery on the northern tip of Manhattan. It's got a huge variety of artifacts, including the tombs of several Medieval counts. Really a fascinating place. Make sure you don't miss the series of unicorn tapestries the place is famous for! They will 100 percent not disappoint.

If you haven't been up to the Cloisters, GO. It is well worth the trip. I went to see the other half of the Heavenly Bodies exhibit, and it was astounding. The history and architecture of the building is so rich and worth the trip. It's also a fantastic opportunity to see artwork you wouldn't see anywhere else. I know it's far but JUST GO OKAY IT'S SO WORTH IT
A great little museum off the beaten path. If you are looking for something unique to do with few tourists around this is it.
It's still close. It will open in the fall of 2019 according to one new's source. The museum should really let their guest know if it open on their website and outside the museum.

One of New York's magical places tucked out of the way but worth the effort. The building is evocative of another era and Pedro de Mena's "Saint Acisclus" sculpture is haunting.  Unlike most other museums in NYC -  it has never been crowded during my visits.

Came for the amazing collection of Joaquin Sorrolla large scale canvases. It's like a holy experience to sit in front of these masterpieces.  Stayed for the antiquities and the history and the great interpretive information.  Don't miss Anna Hyatt Huntington's magnificent sculptures outside in the courtyard of this beautiful historic building. My favorite museum in NYC.
Looks pretty from outside, but as another reviewer mentioned, still closed as of 7/31/18.
great staff and materials .Thank you so much for all your help I really appreciate it.

The Museum of the city of New York is pretty cool it’s very very big building. There are many exhibitions on many floors and the elevators are fast and accessible. The exhibitions are very informational and it has a lot of interesting visual materials but can be a bit dull for children. Barbara D once went to this museum with me and said it was informational inspiring and overall her experience was great.

I think I've enjoyed the museum the most because of two things: 1. I love New York 2. Without the city of New York, there was no reason to have a museum, right?! just think about it, what will be the exhibitions about l? what would be the underline that connects all the art work. 
I think also my sister (which is big new York fan ) will agree with me
Friendly, well informed helpful staff. Very interesting account of American history laid out in beautiful building. Only half way through exhibits and  displays at present....

I go to this museum every time I go to New York. Everyone wants to see the big name museums and they should, but do not miss this jewel. This museum features the city and its people. It’s a wonderful first stop to understand how New York came to be and what makes it special. Do not miss the 30-min movie in the basement. Start there, and then marvel at all the characters and the crazy things that happened in this colorful city in the extremely well-designed exhibits on the main floor. The tickets are reasonably priced, so you can save you money for all the cute stuff in the gift shop. Skip Top-of-the-Rock and do this!

This museum provides a nice documentation of how New York City evolved and grew over the decades. One can easily spent a couple of hours to walk through the museum or a couple days to go through the museum thoroughly. I especially appreciate the Interior Lives exhibition. The cafe is operated by Amy's Bread and it was a pleasure to sit in the airy space to take a mid-day break.

A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE FOR CITIZENS AND ART CONNOISSEURS OF THE WORLD. GREAT COLLECTIONS FOR PROFESSIONALS AND LAY CONSUMERS OF CULTURAL GEMS FROM ALL OVER.
PLUS A GREAT AND INSPIRING BOOKSTORE//GIFT SHOP ON THE GROUND FLOOR SHOULD MOTIVATE PATRONS TO SIGN-UP FOR AT LEAST A ONE-YEAR MEMBERSHIP.
THANKYOU.
EDDIE G.
HARLEM/U.S.A.
It's a beautiful space. Staff can be very helpful. Maybe I look a little bit too white?

The Studio Museum in Harlem is nice place to go see different paintings because they have nice paintings from really good artists who make the nice masterpieces drawing different paintings and those artists are very artistic drawing those paintings they made for people to see how famous the artists are doing nice artwork.
I love it took my son jonathan and my baby said mommy awsome

Got here by accident after hours on their last day before a three year hiatus for a major renovation. Turned out there was a party and we ended up dancing to funky music, drinking beer and having a good time, really off the tourist beaten track. Everyone was super friendly and inviting. Hope the renovation goes well and we can come back in three years and see it. Good luck!
THE MU5EUM DEDIcATED 2 THE LIFE OF MY GRANDPARENT5 & THEIR WORK

This was such a waste of time. As per previous commenters - I was there during advertised hours and made the trek all the way up, only to find the doors locked.  What a joke. Too bad since it would have been interesting/enjoyable to learn more about Malcolm.

Good morning.
Like everyone else in the world. I have an open heart and mind  to the Work and Legacies of Sir. Malcolm X and his dear wife Dr Betty Shabazz. I had the pleasure of attending the  commemorative ceremony on 2-21-2016.  My prayers continually go up to God concerning the family and those they love. Sometimes it seems as if some.people expect them to be stoic  and stiff fleshed. They're just people, who had parents that they love and miss so much. We love you! May God bless them.
Visiting from the UK, came all the way here to find the doors locked and management had apparently left the building nearly two hours prior to closure time.

That was one of the most historical and uplifting exhibit and memorial I have ever seen. It was the high point of my New York visit. Being from Memphis Tn and my first trip to NYC it was an awesome experience. I will never forget the great feeling of walking in the place where Malcolm X spoke and walked. I love Harlem and NYC. THANKS
They have changed not to much of nothing there
I went to, and graduated from Howie T. Harp forensic peer specialist in May 2007. Great building, lots of resources.
I visited my friend that worked upstairs and realized that their are many resources in this building to help the community. 2018
This is the actual alternative school from the 2009 movie Precious
it's a good place

Great neighborhood park. My children loved it when they were much younger. Great for picnics too. The forested areas are some of the oldest in the city with massive tulip trees. Also a great place for birding. This park is were it is alleged Peter Minuit "purchased" Manhattan from the native people. The park itself is pretty safe as are the forested areas but although I've walked them alone many times, I recommend walking with someone else too...cause hey...you never know.

Great neighborhood and family park!!! I've  been going to Inwood Park for very long time and have never been disappointed... Beautiful view of Hudson River, the New Jersey Palisades, and the GW Bridge, so bring your families and enjoy!

Nice location with a lot of restaurants and the park inside is actually CLEAN!! If you wanna spend some time in nature then you’ll like it and definitely wear comfortable shoes. The walk can get grueling.

The last natural forest in Manhattan. So much history here and, so unfettered by the city. Good hiking trails and walking paths. A nice amount of elevation change. Nice expansion over train tracks to the Hudson River and sports fields.

One of the most beautiful parks in NYC (surpassed only by Central Park and Prospect Park). The trails are old growth forest and there are sections where one cannot see any buildings. It's amazing to know that this is on Manhattan! Lots of free activities in the summer and all year access to open grounds to play soccer plus two playgrounds, basketball courts and tennis courts. There is a marsh and beautiful views. Have a bite at Indian Road Cafe close by. Definitely worth the trip from any of the boroughs to spend a day here!

Had the Meatloaf w/ mac' n cheese and greens. Amazing! All the staff was wonderful! Definitely a family felt vibe when there. Also enjoyed the hip hop/r&b background music. Worth the ride from Jersey😜 It was a relief to be in a successful black establishment.

Amazing food! I love that the menu is named after celebrity's. I enjoyed my Gabrielle Union feast! This place is a must see and has so much history and greatness not to mention that food! If you are in NYC please don't miss out!

Took my lady for the 1st time. Watching her enjoy the Candied Yams and the BBQ Ribs was a delight. Very busy for a Wednesday Evening. Great Comfort Food with Accurate, Professional table Service. Home Run Every Time. Did I mention the Banana Pudding..Grand Slam!!!

The cornbread was very good, tasted fresh and a little buttery. Then the fried chicken was yummy. Crispy outside and juicy inside. Then the positive experience stopped there. The BBQ ribs were bad. The meat was way overly cured — VERY dry and very salty, and too much sauce. The vegetables were overcooked. Not a very healthy meal. It’s ok if you want to stop by for an occasional experience. But eating this a lot will get you killed. Did you know, even the previous owner has come out and told people how unhealthy their cooking is? I hope Amy Ruth will adapt with the times and make delicious, yet healthier, food for the community.
Exactly what you hope it will be, which is amazing soul food cooked with love.  Mac and cheese was the best I've ever had.  The banana pudding is superb but huge!  More than enough to share.
Look no further. This is the best Dominican cake in NY. Please take it from me. I'm Dominican and my mom bakes. This is the best quality true to the roots of Dominican cake. Enjoy. Yummy!!
Great selection. Either take out/serve yourself or be served. Good prices

I came here for the lunch special from when I worked day shift at the hospital (now on nights) and for what you pay you will leave with a full belly. Full, but not overly satisfied. I got a TON of rice, some beans and a slice our two of plantains plus a soda. So. Much. Rice. 
It was tasty, but they could definitely use a revamping on how they ration food items.

Being a native Texan and huge Tex-Mex fan, I had high hopes for El Presidente.  First things first, the space is large and the restaurant is pretty popular.  So popular, that the combination of a large crowd + super loud music make it impossible to have a proper conversation.  As for the food, some of the tacos (especially the seafood ones) are fantastic, while there are many misses, as well.  I think the space has a lot of potential, but as much as I love this type of food, I would not go here often.
Delicious 50 cent wings and $1 tacos every day for happy hour. They also make a great, strong margarita and have wonderful service.

Came here after visiting museums and food was great! We got the 17 inch pizza and it was delicious. Staff was really nice and it was such a good vibe/environment. We were greeted immediately, and our food was served very quickly. If you want good pizza, come here after visiting central park.

Yes!.. it’s the best pizza in Spanish Harlem. Maybe, it’s one of the best pizzas in upper Manhattan. Yes, it’s only $14 for a standard pie.  And yes, you should get one now! 

If you live in this area you have probably stood in line at the pick up door (which is the northern-most door), if you haven’t sat in and experienced a taste of history you probably should, and if you care for pizza at all you should try this contender for the best slice. 

I’m just a random guy that lives around the block telling you to live your life right by going here.

Great bread.  Spectacular waiter.  Pizza seems to be good.  Haven’t tried.  Two pasta dishes we ordered were unremarkable.  Not overpriced, but boring.  If I have to add spices at an Italian restaurant ....

You want tradition? You want a place that makes you sit and wait awhile and forces you to have a conversation with one another as your pizza is cooked to perfection?  You want a place that makes you feel cozy and not feel stressed about what you have to wear? Patsy's is one of the original pizza places in New York City keeping the tradition on what it means to be Italian. This place makes you feel like family. Don't be afraid to order something other than pizza because whatever you order will be on point.

Great pizza! cheese, sauces, toppings and even no toppings. We got the basic items from the menu. we order a piece of pie, onions, tomatoes and some basil. I think I like this thin pizza! you may also add pepperoni to it and cheese. Cash only.

I'm very conflicted about this place. The food is excellent, they problem is that they are out of commonly orders items far too often. It's very rare that you can order and receive everything you want.

The dining room has a very nice ambience. It's fairly small but definitely provides an intimate atmosphere

Visiting with a friend, and she read good reviews about the Jerk Chicken. So we went here with the crew. And for the parking in the city? I could park right across the street! It's small, but it is cozy. It is nice, food is great. And the service is very friendly! It was a pleasure eating here. BE AWARE! It is spicy! So if you are not used to that, let them know!

As a Jamaican, I approve. Ordered the jerk chicken; beef & chicken patties. The jerk gravy poured on the rice is delicious & has a good spicy kick. My family also enjoyed the patties. Do hope to be back.

Fantastic food but a little too cramped to have dinner. The roti and goat curry are the best besides my Mom's. The lemonade is excellent. The oxtails are so good. I hope they keep it up. Service is a little slow but the tasty food compensates...👌🏾

"I am absolutely enjoying the meal, atmosphere at Sisters in Harlem. The staff is soooooo engaging! This is Christmas! family, fun and fellowship! Thank you so much for treating us like family" -from my mom-

This was a really interesting place to visit. A calm oasis in the centre of the financial district open to exploration. There are interpretive displays and docents wandering the halls to ask questions. Quite interesting architecture.

I visited NYC with friends and this was only about a block away from Trinity Church. I had no idea this is where President George Washington was sworn in and inaugurated. This is a great piece of American history and a must see if you are anywhere near the World Trade Center area. This is the site of the First US Congress and where George Washington was sworn in as the first US President. The building is post those events but houses a small Museum and is a NPS concern, worth a quick look when in Wall Street.

reviews.author_name: Simon Jester and All Things Funny
reviews.text: A must see when visiting New York. The history and energy of the city can be felt when standing on the steps where Washington gave his inaugural speech. Wall Street and the stock exchange are near by. Anyone who likes architecture or history will enjoy visiting.
Very interesting insight into American history. Just check the times before going to ensure you can catch a tour
Practically free piece of history that is a good time killer for about 30 minutes or so. Piece of early American history

Had a great time as a non-tourist. The elevator trip to the top was quick. A hint: chew some gum or keep moving your jaw to keep from popping your ears because the elevator moves so fast that you don't have a chance to adjust to the height so your ears will pop. There's a treat at the top. Sit down and enjoy the show because it's very informative. They also have a cafe up there so take your time and enjoy the view from up top.

The One world trade center is truly amazing and I loved watching it just sitting around there and gazing and the beautifully constructed massive structure. The observatory area there is also great and loved every second standing there. Completely worth it! One cannot miss this one when in NYC - "The City which never Sleeps!" 
Great experience!

The One World Trade Center is truly a unique place. Nowhere else is this atmosphere of a strong community and sense of exploration. The observatory is absolutely phenomenal. The view is great (as you can see on my added pictures) and the price of 34 bucks is absolutely worth it. GREAT 👍🏼

A real treat... One of the wonders of the World.... Obtain Priority tickets For level 102..fabulous presentation... Make reservations for lunch at level 101st floor... The food was amazing..service and attention excellent.. What a tremendous attraction..the views are awesome.. Best attraction in the city. Worth paying for the observation deck and priority elevators with Ipad information. 360 views of New York. A must do.

This was very cool but I'm frustrated at the price. The views are incredible and the video show in the elevator on the way up is outstanding but this is an experience that everyone should have and paying around $40 per person for an elevator ride is insane. There are a lot of people who want to see this and should see it but the cost prices them out. We wanted to do the Empire State Building as well but that one is also $40 so we had to choose because of the price gouging. That kind of sucks.

Wonderful opportunity to see one of New York's first great office buildings. Knowledgeable guide, the one hour tour has time for photos and taking in the details. Brief look from outside and then an extended period in the lobby before finishing up in the seldom seen basement. Interesting look into New York City history in the early 20th century. Great tour. History of American business that helped explain the man and his building....biggest most elaborate etc. Very glad I took the tour. Recommend it!

I always wanted to see inside this magnificent building. I have a special connection to it, my grandfather was a window washer here in the late 1950’s until the mid 1960’s.Our guide was fantastic! He showed us all around the building and took us to a tour only private area of the building. Well worth the price if admission! I finally got to see the windows that my grandfather worked so hard to keep clean. That meant a lot to me.Thank you!!!

Lovely, but very small coffee shop close to City Hall. Quirky space with high quality pulling of coffee drinks. Really tasty pastries, including salty chocolate chip and a gluten free golden syrup cookie. The staff is always friendly and welcoming and knows the orders of their regulars. They have some delicious sounding small plates, I'll try them and get back with an updated review!

Beautiful Architecture!! The way NYC used to look everywhere! I wish more new buildings would use this Victorian Gothic Style Architecture instead of the unimaginative plain glass boring buildings that have cropped up over the years. Definitely a must see while in the Financial District.

Our guide Ray was great and even gave us a bit more time. Very knowledgeable of course, it was a clear and interesting presentation giving also some perspective with the overall NYC skyscraper scene. I would definitely recommend 90 minutes more than 30min actually given how much you can learn.

The David N. Dinkins Manhattan Municipal Building located at 1 Centre Street in Loer Manhattan is a awesome Building.  

Tall, grand, imposing, large by any building standards, and the tenants have some of the best NYC views.

Saturated at the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge, and directly across from New York’s City Hall.  It is up the street from the Civil Center, where all the courthouses of New York City and State sits.  

The pinnacle of New York City’s power is here and all around it.  

Marriage licenses are issued in the David N. Dinkins Manhattan Municipal Building.  So it is a very important place for New Yorkers and Foreigners to know, as it is the place where folks will commit to a lifetime of happiness.

What an architecturally interesting building! I love the view of it from Brooklyn and as you are crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. The building was designed by the historic McKim, Mead, and White firm in 1914 and was the first to incorporate a subway station inside. The architecture is very unique and has been described as Roman Imperial, French Renaissance, and Italian Renaissance. It served as the inspiration for the Wrigley Building in Chicago. It’s currently home to over 2000 employees.

Historically the building itself holds the strong arm of the law and justice. The area around including tree filled sitting parks and a stroll across The Brooklyn Bridge makes for a wonderful afternoon or late night walk with the stars.
A very photogenic building in lower Manhattan.
The David N. Dinkins Municipal Building necessitated seven years to be built and is the most impressive and magnificent building in this part of New York City.
This place is amazing! Very clean with a super nice staff. I learned so much and I wish this monument had more recognition.

Was a beautiful monument and a very sad and powerful piece of history. I think the city could’ve done more to acknowledge what they have done though and still are.  It’s currently being protected by scaffolding cause of the building going on next to it. Also the government shutdown prevented us from being able to see it close up.
A place full of historical facts, a small viewing room, and a nice gift shop. The burial ground is around the corner from the entrance.
Ancestors will communicate to and breathe a new sense of purpose and life into those who have sincerity, curiosity, respect, and destiny.
It's Remarkable truth we all need to know

View the absolutely riveting Black & White photography....walk in the garden... Somehow being so near the Hudson River means you are 
in for educational & peaceful experience in  BATTERY PARK NYC.

not as much to see as I'd like. there are some new installations in process but right now there isn't that much with the exception of the virtual reality portion. the virtual reality part is actually really interesting. they did a good job with the filming of it

Amazing place.There is a stone garden outside the museum and the walls are made of granite. There are 18 large-scale boulders of various shapes lying on the ground, reflecting the strong power and extraordinary adaptability of the Jewish nation. A small cave was cut into each of the rocks as a planting trough, and then a dwarfed chestnut sapling was planted in the rock, so each tree was “long” with a small sapling. This unique The landscape has become the biggest feature of the stone garden.

This lovely museum was under construction and we didn't see the whole museum. The building is close the sea and has beautiful sceneries from the windows and from the touching little garden outside. Trees are growing from a stones like jewish people stayed alive after terrible history. Also little cafeteria where we tasted Haman ears with coffee.

What a superb Yiddish production of "Fiddler on the Roof" -- without doubt the most moving production of that musical we have ever seen.  And to be in such proximity to Castle Garden, Ellis Island -- I was emotionally overcome seeing Lady Liberty after we exited the theater.  While I am delighted the show is moving to Broadway, I feel very lucky to have experienced the exquisitely intimate and rather ingenious staging at the museum.  Kudos.

A must to visit in New York city! It presents the history of the NYPD and educates everyone about its role in keeping the city in order. It also highlights the history of the department. They have educational progams and exhibits that make it definitely an interesting visit!
Hey NYPD get your act together. Anyone know why its closed? I went there yesterday to find out it was and yet google shows hours smh. very disappointing so much for showing NYPD in good light. smh

reviews.author_name: ma vision des chose le guide et voyageur
reviews.text:
Police department
City of new york un jolie musé
The website said it was open 1 PM on Tuesday afternoon all doors were locked tight.  rang a bell no one answered & called the # on the website no answer. very disappointed
One of the most interesting police museums in the USA. A must visit location in New York City

You must visit this small museum in NY, if you have some spare rime.

1. It's completely free! Great point. Donation box included. 

2. There are a lot of objects to see, if you are interested in this theme.

3. The location itself is comfortable and clean. 

My recommendations.

This is a small must see here in NYC! it gives a fabulous history of the ports, and ocean liners, and other shipping histories of NYC. It is a small museum and doesn't take long to walk through. It is also free (but has a donation box! Bring some cash!) I learned so much in this little museum and it was amazing. Then being able to see some of the ships that were highlighted in the museum out in the port was icing on the cake! I love it! Go see this museum!

We went on a sunset cruise on the museum's schooner PIONEER (an 1885 historic sailing vessel and part of South Street Seaport Museum's operational fleet). 

Thanks to the crew for a wonderful sunset cruise with beautiful views on the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline.

We brought a afternoon snack and a bottle of wine and enjoyed the sail very much!

The sign on the building that points to the museum seems to be bigger than the museum... the whole precinct is historic and is worth a visit and since you're there you might as well drop into this tiny museum.

Nice little museum, perfectly located at this old neighborhood, that keeps the history of the original port of the city of alive. The boat is included in the ticket price and is a must see. People on board will gladly answer any questions and will give you a small tour. Great experience if you have never been on this kind of boats before. The rest of the museum will give you an idea of the immigrant experience when they were arriving in the city, but it's better if you visit Ellis Island, so that you get the whole picture.

An incredible view into our past. Worth the time and money. Great for the entire family. Here's something you need to know, if you plan to walk up the stairs inside the statue of liberty you cannot buy tickets for that at any ticket booth you must schedule that in advance online! We found that out dissapointingly the hard way and we did not get the chance to do it. Maybe next year. I hope this helps. Enjoy yourselves.
👌 If you enjoyed reading this post please ' LIKE '  it. Thank you 😉
Nice place for picnic

Took the Ferry out to Ellis Island first and then the Statute of Liberty. Loved the tour of the Emigration museum on Ellis Island. 

I could identify with the Irish experience. From 1820 to 1920, 4 million Irish people passed through the gates. Got a sense of how daunting and exciting it must have been for those who had arrived. Sent chills down my spine to be honest. 

The tours themselves around the building were frequent and I thought well presented.

The Statue of liberty was having repairs at the time I went in 2012 so just walked around the outside. The statue itself is made of copper and is green due to oxidation. At the time I did not know that.

Would recommend both while in NY.

Great trip to see the Statue of Liberty. If you want to go into the pedestal of the statue, you have to book it ahead of time. It costs around $18 per person. It does get crowded but if you book ahead of time, you will have a definite reservation. Which is a good thing. Lots of history. Take the kids.

An incredible view into our past. Worth the time and money. Great for the entire family. Here's something you need to know, if you plan to walk up the stairs inside the statue of liberty you cannot buy tickets for that at any ticket booth you must schedule that in advance online! We found that out dissapointingly the hard way and we did not get the chance to do it. Maybe next year. I hope this helps. Enjoy yourselves.
👌 If you enjoyed reading this post please ' LIKE '  it. Thank you 😉
Nice place for picnic

Took the Ferry out to Ellis Island first and then the Statute of Liberty. Loved the tour of the Emigration museum on Ellis Island. 

I could identify with the Irish experience. From 1820 to 1920, 4 million Irish people passed through the gates. Got a sense of how daunting and exciting it must have been for those who had arrived. Sent chills down my spine to be honest. 

The tours themselves around the building were frequent and I thought well presented.

The Statue of liberty was having repairs at the time I went in 2012 so just walked around the outside. The statue itself is made of copper and is green due to oxidation. At the time I did not know that.

Would recommend both while in NY.

Great trip to see the Statue of Liberty. If you want to go into the pedestal of the statue, you have to book it ahead of time. It costs around $18 per person. It does get crowded but if you book ahead of time, you will have a definite reservation. Which is a good thing. Lots of history. Take the kids.

Had a great time as a non-tourist. The elevator trip to the top was quick. A hint: chew some gum or keep moving your jaw to keep from popping your ears because the elevator moves so fast that you don't have a chance to adjust to the height so your ears will pop. There's a treat at the top. Sit down and enjoy the show because it's very informative. They also have a cafe up there so take your time and enjoy the view from up top.

The One world trade center is truly amazing and I loved watching it just sitting around there and gazing and the beautifully constructed massive structure. The observatory area there is also great and loved every second standing there. Completely worth it! One cannot miss this one when in NYC - "The City which never Sleeps!" 
Great experience!

The One World Trade Center is truly a unique place. Nowhere else is this atmosphere of a strong community and sense of exploration. The observatory is absolutely phenomenal. The view is great (as you can see on my added pictures) and the price of 34 bucks is absolutely worth it. GREAT 👍🏼

A real treat... One of the wonders of the World.... Obtain Priority tickets For level 102..fabulous presentation... Make reservations for lunch at level 101st floor... The food was amazing..service and attention excellent.. What a tremendous attraction..the views are awesome.. Best attraction in the city. Worth paying for the observation deck and priority elevators with Ipad information. 360 views of New York. A must do.

This was very cool but I'm frustrated at the price. The views are incredible and the video show in the elevator on the way up is outstanding but this is an experience that everyone should have and paying around $40 per person for an elevator ride is insane. There are a lot of people who want to see this and should see it but the cost prices them out. We wanted to do the Empire State Building as well but that one is also $40 so we had to choose because of the price gouging. That kind of sucks.
Nice people, good sandwiches, reasonable prices
Good and neat.

As a long term denizen of the neighborhood, and a good judge of character and management, I strongly urge people to avoid supporting Terry's with purchases of their goods until management demonstrates they care about customer and the community. Sadly, most posts on sites like Yelp are instigated by exceptionally good or bad service, and this falls into the latter.  I have lived in 41 River Terrace for four years, and have never been treated so poorly by an employee, anywhere, as I was today at Terry's Deli. I have spoken to management and await decisive action, but until then, encourage everyone to select a new deli - such as the 24 hour deli just 100 feet down the block.

The issue started out very small with a problem that has occurred more frequently than it should. A sandwich I purchased was missing an ingredient - in this case the tuna in my tuna sandwich. I begrudgingly returned to the store to have it added, when the real problems began. The sandwich maker immediately chided me that it was I who made the mistake and did not tell him to add tuna. Instead, I had only requested vegetable toppings, no meat, on my sandwich. For context, I'm a man in my 30's, I also bought a muscle milk, and the only sandwich I order there is a tuna sandwich - every time!  I tried to brush this off, and also pointed out that I had not forgotten to tell the cashier I paid for a tuna sandwich, and for which I was charged. I was still willing to let this treatment roll off my back, but he insisted I admit I was wrong before he would fix my sandwich, and became angry about it, complete with expletive. At this point, I voiced my displeasure and requested his name and to speak with management. I was told his name is "Mr. Nobody" and management is not available, nor is there a phone number. This strikes me as an unusual way to manage! Sadly, other employees whom I know for a long time stood by and watched this unfold, unwilling to intervene, or offer a name and number for the manager, either.

What this made me reflect on is the following. Without accountability in the store, and a respect for members of our community, what other disagreeable things are likely going on behind the scenes? Are they responsible stewards of our families and children who trust Terry's to provide wholesome food and other products at reasonable prices? Out of respect for this Trinidad family-owned business and the other delis they operate in NYC, and for the vast majority of the staff whom I have befriended over the years, I am refraining from further action. It turns out Mr. Nobody does have a first and last name, and it's on the lips of management right now. I am awaiting swift and decisive action to convince me that they do care about our community and their patrons. Terminating Mr. Nobody's employment, and visibly educating staff that there exists an obligation to care for and respect community members would be a good start. In the meantime, I will be shopping elsewhere and suggest community members do the same.
one off the employees put pepper in my bbq sauce every time i go the he offer me pepper i would refuse so he put it in my bbq sauce that is not nice

The place to go for Stuyvesant kids. It's a well priced lunch and the food isn't bad. It's a lunch deli to most, but to us Stuyvesant students, its like a 3 star restaurant. It should be a duty of upperclassmen to tell freshman about terry's. The Stuy experience is lacking without a weekly trip to terry's.

The park is a perfect little oasis to escape the city! Carol’s Cafe does great coffee and bagels, there’s wheelchair/pram access to the main level and it’s decorated for the holidays. Lots of tables for laptops and if you need white noise while you work, the waterfall is perfect!
Very beautiful to sit down and appreciate. You can eat brunch/lunch here or just visit for free.

Wonderfully pristine and serene park in the midtown! Love to come here during my lunch break just to breathe in the almost tropical air and gaze at the little bit of nature that has grown so beautifully here. And yes, there is a wonderful waterfall to quiet the nearby conversations, if you need to meditate or read a book.

There is also a small cafe there with some delicious food!

Beautiful hidden gem in NYC. You would not expect to find such a place if you are in the area for the first time. You will hear the roar of the waterfall from the sidewalk which is not common in the city:) You can close your eyes and forget that you are in the middle of Manhattan with the serenity of the waterfall and chirping birds. It's worth a visit! Definitely one of the best spots in the city to unwind and feel refreshed.

One of New York City’s most beautiful “secret” parks. 

A great place to read a book, chat with a friend and many more. 

The waterfall is also great too!

One of the most original, beautiful and amazing skyscraper in Manhattan. Located on Lexington Avenue. It's luxuriously decorated in art deco style inside and with gargoyles just below the top. 
You can see it's distinguished flaky top with a needle from the different parts of New York City, even from Long Island. 
It's also the second tallest building in the city centre. 
Highly recommended to everyone to observe

This is just the most beautiful building to me. And the night just gives it a whole new facade. 

I could not go into the building, so if you reading this a tour or observation deck would just be super!

Check it out from the Empire Stare or Top of the Rock at night, so worth it.

Just an iconic building, loved it. Found on Lexington avenue. Got some good photos. Don't think you can go up like the Rock and Empire State, but I went into the reception area and took some great photos, we'll worth a look. Also just across the road is Grand central market that is a great place to look around and is part of the Grand central station complex nearby. Great area to walk around, with all major buildings quite close together. Felt inspired walking around all the great architecture with the Xmas lights as a bonus.
Very beautiful on the inside.  The decor is one of the finest ever designed in a building. I worked there so I'm use to the beauty.

What's not to love about this iconic art deco NYC landmark building.  Original lobby and elevators make you feel like you're stepping into a time machine.  The lobby is open to the public but you'll need access to visit the upper floors.  If you're ever on any of the higher floors you can sneak up to the old Cloud Club on the 67th floor for a rare glimpse into the past.
It's nice to see. Unusual and unexpected hall. Free access for everyone.
It's happening right now.

Home of Superman’s Daily Planet (inspiration for, at least). Publishers of the once great daily news. Bankrupt rag that it is, still houses a midtown must-see. Huge rotating globe surrounded by floor with brass rays showing direction and distance to the world’s notable cities. Great thing for kids too
Entrance looks very impressive.
Superman - says everything.

Seriously? It's a building and the lobby provides an access path to Grand Central Terminal. We just walk through the lobby. If you don't fall on a banana peel and a beam doesn't fall on you, it's a success: 5 stars!
Easy shortcut, less congested route,  from Grand Central terminal to Park Avenue. Just take the escalator up from the main.floor. it will save you 10 minutes.
Of course. Grand Central Station is underneath. Love it.

Came to donate blood at the New York Blood Center.
Great location.  Not so crowded on weekends.
Just beautiful,  it has everything in that building. A must experience.

This was my first visit to this iconic venue in New York City and was not disappointed. It was fantastic. It was built and recently restored in an art deco style, which is stunning. When I was there in late November, the Christmas Show with the Rockettes was showing, but unfortunately was not able to book tickets, as I was not in town long enough. However I do the Stage Door Tour and was well worth doing. The rest rooms deserve a particular mention, as they are true art deco style. A visit here will not leave you disappointed. Well worth it.
That review was back in November 2016. Now we're in 2019, I've come back to NYC for a few days and came back to Radio City Music Hall. Still as magical as ever.

Ahhh love it love it love it! We went for a choir walk through. They give tours but only 19 at a time just for heads up. They take you through all of the floors and areas where they record every Saturday night live showing, we saw the stand for where they enter and got to see the set up for the bands that play with every star. Going through a hallway they have pictures dating back to the first Saturday night live. We were given magnetic pins that say applause and the staff and tour guides knew our names and remembered them throughout the whole tour. They gave us a small session of making our own Saturday night live video and it was fun. There was a sound crew, camera crew, a host, a spokesperson, the band and a special guest. They made the tour fun and eventful, and they pointed out cool facts such as one of the studios (dare not say which) has the same fold up seats from the very first show. A secret also is that they have a garden gnome and every star rubs his face for good fortune and luck. We never saw it but they say he has been there since the beginning of the NBC recordings. Then they will take you down the stairs and guide you the souvenir shop where every show is separated and has their own section so if you love f.r.i.e.n.d.s or Jimmy Fallon or maybe the news, then they have something for you.

Awsome place. Super great place to visit. I think everybody should come and visit here at least once in there life time. We had a blast here and cant wait to come back. Thank you so much for giving us a great experience here, Thank you and we cant wait to come back.
If my review helps you in any way PLEASE give me a thumbs up like on my review.
Thank you.

Take everyone you know to go see this show during Christmas, this is an experience that you will never forget. This place looks small on the outside, but is huge on the inside. There is food available inside and plenty of restrooms. The actual show itself is just amazing, you won't regret it. Enjoy!!

Clean and the staff was kind. They helped me find my seat and the concession stands were manned with very polite staff. I've been there several times and marvel at how fast the bathroom Line moves. I enjoyed my show and can't wait for my extra visit...

I had no idea what I missed in previous trips to New York by not going to the UN headquarters. I was absolutely floored at the quality of the tour and how much of the UN we got to see. The tour guides were extremely knowledgeable about the UN, the art, and any other questions we had. There is a lot to see even outside the tour, so arrive a little early or stay a little late. they were able to accommodate our group of 12. We bought tickets early online which made everything very easy.

I got emotional when I entered the building for the first time. I went to NYC for a model UN and I absolutely had a wonderful experience. Entrance procedures took a long time but it was obviously for a good cause: security was strict. I felt safe.

This place was amazing. The views and sights were amazing on the outside. Just a pleasure to see. The inside was even better, the area was gigantic with many cool aspects inside. The stairs was a bit of a walk but other than that a very cool place indeed.

Great place for earth's peace if humans would walk in peaceful pace. Iconic memorabilia including the Transatlantic Slavery's Lest We Forget. Breathtaking art and act of life. Go there, a place to go go!
#TeamYowamca
It's a great place to tour and they help keep world peace. What more can you ask for.  The inside is basically an art museum with a lot of interesting exhibits to look at.

Beautiful church with a breathtaking atmosphere. The carols here are spectacular. The church is great even for a quiet solitary visit to get away from the noise of the city and to self reflect, regardless of your religion or culture. For me the Holy Spirit is so powerful in this church. One of the few places that I feel one with God.

A Gothic Style And Episcopal Church Gem.  It Was Built In 1914, And It Is Astonishing.  It Is A Must Visit!  The Statues And The Other Decorations Make This A Wonder To Visit.  Been There Several Times But Pictures In Real Time Will Be Added Soon.
Gorgeous please! My favorite church. Beautiful and peaceful bay in the middle of the rush of 5th Avenue

Stopped in for the EvenSong... Lovely voices. I am always amazed at the soprano voices in a men and boys choir. The readings from the Collect were intriguingly blended in my mind... The expulsion of Hagar (Gen16) and the expulsion of Jesus (Mark6). When I think of the text that Jesus read from Isaiah, I can't help but think of Hagar.
Elegant arcatecture, beautiful choral music. A perfect spiritual home.

A wonderful experience. I visited the Tolkien exhibit, but their library is spectacular. Well worth a visit if you're in the area. A longish, but quite doable walk from Penn Station. I had lunch in the restaurant, and it was very good, and the prices were reasonable for the location and experience.

Gorgeous building with a marvellous, well-curated small collection. If you're interested in medieval manuscripts, it's a must-see. Went for the Tolkien Exhibit and Symposium, and it was delightful. The accessibility is the reason for 1 star off. The stage in the newly added auditorium doesn't have wheelchair access, making the disabled speaker sit on the floor. There's no excuse for that in a 21st century addition. The gift shop is also odd to access, requiring use of a staff elevator and security. They're small things but contribute overall to the impression of belonging or not belonging. Nonetheless, will definitely return when we come back to Manhattan.

The Morgan maybe my favorite museum in the city.  

The exhibits are top notch and looking at all the old books is always fun. 

I have been to the Morgan for an event in the auditorium and the acoustics and venue was great as well.  

I'll probably go back for the Lord of the Rings exhibit currently going on and have some of the fun curated tea with mead and honey cakes at the cafe.  

Also, its free on Fridays after 7pm

I absolutely loved visiting. They currently have an amazing Tolkien exhibit, a photo exhibit borrowed from the Canadian national gallery, and an exhibit of sketches from the Italian Renaissance. I took a group of students and they enjoyed it. The library also gave our group free admission because we had a large group of students with military parents. The library is beautiful—better than anything from Beauty and the Beast. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Midtown.

A very charming museum and gallery. When I was there they had a Mary Shelley exhibit which was very interesting. The staff however was a but gruff, but were helpful in getting around. The library itself, that is, the library that Morgan himself owned, is probably the most interesting portion of the library/museum because of its many antiques and Gutenberg Bibles.

Are you a lover of modern art of all mediums? Are you interested in Slovenian artists and the inspiration behind their works? If so, this museum is not to be missed. There are many interesting paintings, sculptures, video artworks, and other curiosities. If you are squeamish about you or your children seeing nudity, this gallery may not be your cup of tea. But if you are comfortable seeing a few naked body art works sprinkled in with the other art work, do stop by. The museum has a downstairs coffee bar/lounge and lecture hall for talks.  I really enjoyed the museum and its art works.

Half of the space is permanent exhibition and other half is actual and temporary, usually open three times a year for a few months; always interesting topic. 
Otherwise calm and chilly space, where time and thoughts run slower tempo.

I was left speechless. The exhibits are so beautifully pieced together that it is almost impossible to peel your eyes off them. You will need about an hour to go through the whole gallery, after which you can relax in the cafè bellow the gallery itself. The gallery also provides a student discount, so be sure to bring your students' card!

Beautiful bulging and interesting permanent collection. You will need 30 minutes-1 hour to see it all. The temporary exhibition space is big and well organised. The thicket costs only 5 euros: an extra reason to have this insight into modern Slovenia. Visit the coffee downstairs if you have a little time.
One of my favourite places in Ljubljana to have a nice cup of coffee or tea and stay close to modern art. Highly recommended.

I went to a exhibit for Black History Month. The staff and exhibit was a great experience. I will be returning more often. Park in the garage near the Center. Many places to eat in the area. Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall are steps away. Public transportation is the best way to go.

It isn't a traditional museum. It's more of a library where you get to view their catalog of video collections. They have a lot of stuff including some really old TV commercials I enjoyed a lot. I also recommended the new video game section they're developing. There you can play some of the latest games (VR!!).

The Paley Center for Media is the quintessential New York City must see! Especially if you're like me and enjoy their on-going interactive Video Game exhibit! Thanks for the great customer service as well!

Great place for meeting celebrities and catching up on interview. They staff is so friendly and nice. They answer inquiries before, during and after shows. Depending on the celebrity you're trying to see it may or may not get crowded. 
Would come back again for a convention. It's great for start up journalists to get interviews from some celebrities.

I have visited this space twice: once for a panel and once for an awards ceremony. The space is versatile and features a variety of rooms. Waitstaff and bars were a feature at the most recent event I attended in this space, and they were able to service the crowd with ease.

I also had the please of sitting in the theatre downstairs. It was spacious and clean. My only complaint was the lack of visible seat numbers, which made finding our reserved seats challenging.

Overall, I would recommend this space for events.

Cool spot. Eat outside on the sunny terrace complete with heat lamps or inside, at the front row of the skating rink. The menu is slightly limited but varied at the same time, we were all satisfied with our choices. The hostesses were welcoming and we had non stop attention from the waiting staff. A bit pricey but hey... you are in Bryant Park!

What a neat concept to shake the winter time blues in Midtown. Warm up from ice skating with a cocktail, bacon mac n cheese and enjoy toasty seating outside on couches under heat lamps or indoors by the bar. I really enjoyed the service, drinks, food and view while I was here at this very trendy, modern winter bar; however, the prices are way too steep. I get that the place has to make money, but this felt like highway robbery, even for NYC. $18 for a small dish of mac n cheese, $15 highball of whiskey ginger... talk about breaking the bank. We had a great time and wish we could come back, but sadly, that will be our last.

Chic and luxury - this place allows you to enjoy some glamour on white couches under heat lamps while indulging in good food and rinks and overlooking the ice skating rink!

Who doesn't love Bryant Park. Now, this restaurant brings something else to do in this beautiful park. Celebrate a birthday, have a happy hour and connect with friends or just come for the heck of it. Celsius is beautiful themed place and fun to go to, especially during the winter months. The staff here are some of the friendliest in the city and are always willing to ensure you have a GREAT TIME! 

Relatively priced for New York City. It can get packed during the busier hours, especially Friday evenings but if you do get in, you will enjoy a fun night with everyone while indulging in delicious food and drinks.
