One of my favorite winter places in NYC. A must visit each year. The service is great. Perfect for a quick bite and few drinks. Love sitting with friends under the heat lamps outside enjoying the view of the ice skating rink !! The best Blood Orange Margaritas !!

Celsius is a pop-up restaurant in Bryant Park - it is nice to sit inside or outside.  They have tables outside with heated lamps and a great view of the skating rink.  The menu is somewhat limited, but they have fun winter themed drinks!

It's restricted zone. Employees and those with proper ID card issued by UN organisation are can enter into inside the premises. Superb architecture and paintings can see inside. Food at affordable price available. We have to according to item and it's weight. I beside Hudson river. We can enjoy river side view. It's very nice see most of the city's skyline buildings. Only issue is unbearable chilled weather. We have to wear thermals and proper jackets and hand gloves to care our ourselves
Thoroughly enjoy myself every time I visit
Have had no response from reservation application for 2 days.

Great place to connect at the UN if you know anyone there. Security is kinda tight, considering it's the UN. Drinks are fairly bad. Food too, but the space is gorgeous. The UN is full of artifacts from around the world. They're mostly gifts from member countries and they kind of give the place its historic vibe. The UN itself is rather young, but there's a thousand years of culture in it.

My husband and I went there last week for lunch. First, the beautiful dining room was not available that day so we were ushered into some awful replacement room with no view period.  The food was mediocre at best. The pasta Fagioli soup was disgraceful. The cous cous accompanying the rack of lamb was not hot and the dessert of fruit and cheese arrived with a small bowl of nuts which were old and tasteless. Oh well. If you read this review think twice before going for a very expensive and not good experience.

The best bagel shop in NYC. There’s a reason I keep going back and standing in lines for these bagels. The texture is just right—it’s something substantial to bite into. Just firm enough on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. Heaven. This shop has been open for a WHILE so expect the typical gruff NYC level of hospitality. They know what they’re doing and they keep the lines moving along as best they can. The egg & cheese is an awesome bargain, and if you’re lucky you may be able to score a table. Whole wheat everything is my current favorite. I miss the Oat Bran still though #RIP

P.S. If you just want to order bagels as-is you can skip the longer line for sandwiches—just head straight to the back!

I am not sure how different the bagels here are with the bagels from your normal Deli. The bagels that we ordered after an hour of waiting were actually good but not that special like the hype says. I should’ve just ordered the plain with cream cheese. I am not sure if waiting in a long line is really worth it.

They really need to get their line in order, it's poorly set up especially given they have a lot of tourists in there. Bagels were good. I wonder if they changed something since last time I was there because the bagels we're a bit drier than I remember. I wish they would add salt to the everything bagel as well.

I had the pumpernickel bagel with jalapeno cream cheese. The bagel was very tasty, a doughy inside with a crispy outside - exactly how I like my bagels to be. The flavour was also delicious and the cream cheese had the perfect amount of kick to it for a breakfast sandwich. They definitely provide more cream cheese than bagel, so if you want more of a 1:1 ratio or less then I would recommend asking for the cream cheese on the side so you can spread it yourself. My friend ordered the apple cinnamon cream cheese and I also thought it was delicious, great balance of cinnamon to apple.

Received our first order from Essa Bagel delivered to NC. Wow! These bagels are amazing! We ordered Salt, pumpernickel, everything and cinnamon raisin as well as scallion cream cheese and lox cream cheese. The lox cream cheese is really perfect. They arrived so quickly and were packaged incredibly well. Can’t wait for our next order!
Thank you Essa Bagel for an amazing first impression!!

We sat for two pretty quickly. Once we sat, it took a second to get our order but once our order was in the food came out fast. The food was good and the service stirred my food for me since I looked like an amateur and recommended the sauce; I not an amateur but I appreciated it as she was way better than I was at it. Was a bit slow to get the bill but I didn’t mind. I’m not sure if the wait is always non-existent but given the wait for other spots in the area, it’s worth popping your head in.

The food was good but the service was poor. We asked repeatedly for a take out container after finishing our meal and our waitress didn’t even acknowledge our request. She turned her back on us and then asked another waiter to bring a container. We had tipped less as a result. She came back with the bill and questioned why we tipped less and whether she offered poor service. We said “yes” and without even giving us a chance to reply she left. We enjoy the food here but the service leaves us not wanting to return.

Delicious food. Surpassed my expectations. However, they were out of one menu item I wanted to order. Bustling & cheerful environment inside. I dined alone and although there was a line out the door after I was seated, didn't feel rushed or overlooked at all. Hope to eat here again someday.

We had a wonderful meal. They were extremely busy, but the service was awesome. Food came very quickly. We got meals that came in the hot bowls. They were sizzling and smelled wonderful. They tasted even better. We just happened on Han Bat as we were walking by. Great decision to go in.

I went there few weeks ago around 1:00 am that was perfect choice. We were staying at hotel next door and look for restaurant open that time. All Staff was really friendly and place was so cozy. We ordered some of beef dishes, especially I tried cold spicy noodle and it was really savory. Me and my wife have never tried Korean Food before but we definitely go back again!

There is a reason this place is a classic. Keens is a great place to celebrate. They are surprisingly large with multiple floors with separate rooms which makes things feel more private. They have excellent steak, and all the appetizers are amazing. Their customer service is top notch. There was a guy in our room who had a medical emergency, and they calmly got him out before most of the diners had noticed anything was wrong.

Expensive However, good portions, very high quality meat, broccoli and cauliflower delicious, and the old fashioned was superb. Food came out super fast. Overall, for these prices, they could've taken more time to season the steak better but still the best beef I've had in this country. Best scotch menu on the planet and experience is worthwhile the place is full of history and setting unique. a must try at least hit the bar drinks alone will knock your socks off..
This place is solid. Has great seating and the staff is super nice. The steak portions are huge and always juicy. No steak sauce needed! Highly recommended!

One of the best steakhouses ever. Absolutely special. We found it by chance and were lucky to find room. Better to reserve in advance . Astonishing meat served with as well amazing wines. Their porterhouse is legendary.

Using a recommendation, from someone who was given a recommendation and tried it, I tried it, and was suitably impressed.  The food was fantastic, the service even better, and the atmosphere was very relaxing. A beautiful and interesting place to eat, and have a drink at the bar, it is now on my list of places to visit again, when I'm in new York next. Making it one of the attractions I would recommend to anyone visiting the big apple, along with lady liberty, the empire state building and times square

One of the best restaurants in town. By far the best selection of fresh sushi. They have a few hours they do not sell it. They deliver too with Mr. Delivery. The food is always hot fast and fresh. There is times where a reservation may be needed. They get quite busy on Friday and Saturday nights.
Our waitress was very nice and helped us with any questions we had. Nice quiet environment. The food was good!
Great food. We got a meal for two (fine two of us) and there was way too much food. Would recommend an ordering ratio of two meals per three or four people.

The food was excellent. We came in on a very snowy night, so the warm and delicious food was very welcome! The restaurant is a good size and the menu looked very good and authentic Korean. The braised short ribs (gal-bi) were especially delicious. The spicy isn't very spicy, but was still delicious. We didn't try the barbeque, but others around us did and it smelled amazing. We plan to come back and give that a try as well!

Excellent!  My wife and I had lunch here with our boys.  This was my wife’s first time eating Korean food and our server was extremely helpful.  The food was as good as the service.  Highly recommended.

Nice atmosphere. Great food. Music is a bit loud but nothing you can't speak over but you can enjoy. Food is most definitely shareable plates. Good for a date, out with girlfriends. Also have bar available. Juan James was my waiter very delightful server. Knowledgeable about selection on menu.

Ordered the LUNCH PREFIX and some appetizers
After a really bad experience at $248 seasonal tasting menu of Jean-George NYC, I found the food here is good.
Tempura is crispy, dumpling, short ribs, and chili all turn out to be good. Mushroom as sides is really good.

Service is good even for lunch, our servant definitely is professional.

Deduct 1 point for long waiting for the food, 40min for appetizer, 30min for entree, 20min for desert.

Beautiful place, very good food but unfortunately bad service. We were in our last nigh in NYC and reserved a table at the TAO uptown on a Friday night 22:15 h to celebrate our trip and regretted very much. We arrived on time for our reservation and even with the restaurant half full only the hostess made us wait for 30 min for a table. On the table the food came fast but we could not really enjoy the time as the waiter was pushing us to keep ordering stuff. I was not even finished with my first drink and she was already pushing me to order another one. After I finished my meal she rushed us with the desert menu. I was not even ready to think about it so I asked to skip for the time. Then she came already with the check. All this in less the 40 minutes. I felt that I was In a fast food place. The only thing that saved was that after telling the story to the manager of the place he truly apologized for the situation and offered as another drink. I am adding this comment because I believe that a nice place as this should be more carefull in instructing the waiting team to leave the customer to experience the place and have a good time.

My family went there for a birthday celebration for a party of 8 at night. The waiting staff was very friendly. He was courteous and very knowledge of the food and drink menu. This place is very crowded at night because of its popularity but great place to eat nevertheless. The ambience and decor was beautiful and tasteful. Everything we ordered was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this place.

Came here for restaurant week lunch. Ordered the spring rolls appetizer, pad Thai main and mango sorbet in coconut milk dessert. The spring rolls were good, pad Thai was okay. I thought it could have been much better. Going forward I will stick to sushi when I come to Tao. The dessert was really interesting. It tasted like a bowl of fruity pebbles and milk. Something different and I would say it was my favorite part of the meal. My only other complaint would be on how slow the service was. Most of us ordered from the restaurant week menu and it took about 10-15 minutes between when they cleared the main to bring out the desserts (which most of us had preordered). Otherwise, the ambiance was nice and food was pretty good.
The open mic here has a great vibe and the sound of the building is amazing.
Great church with a great community that meets here on Sunday mornings!
Very interesting church with a crypt with Roman remains...
Bardzo ciekawy kościół. Ładne wnętrze.

This is a great way to get last minute tickets. They move you along briskly, so it's good to know what you want to see when you get there.

It would be nice if there was a better way to see where you can sit. As it currently stands, the seller just says some seat numbers and says if ye thinks they're good seats. What can I say, I like to see for myself.

Definitely worth the shot if you have few shows in mind. Evening show sales starts at 3 PM so don't do the queue early morning for late shows ;) no matter if you are a tourist or living in New York City you can get from 20-50% off depending the seat category option every day. It closes at 8 PM same hour than evening shows start. Definitely recommend as this is a good place for last minute deal.
Awesome place to get discounted tickets. Digital screens help you choose while you wait. A helpful staff also can give info about the shows/plays. Usually very crowded :(

Definitely a great place to stop by and grab tickets. If you line up at off times, the wait is relatively short. I'd say the line moves a lot quicker than you'd anticipate! Quick and friendly service so no complaints here!

Always helpful and useful!

Plan to arrive early (30m-1h) if you want a specific show. Use the app to see what shows will be available. Employees can help with basic questions on shows and how TKTS works. Be ready with what you want by the time you get to the window !

I love this museum! It is an amazing and beautifully made exhibition that grows larger every day. The details and precision in creating these pieces are worth anybody's time, I have been there twice, and am still planning to visit as soon as I'm in Manhattan. It's always exciting to see new things being added to your city. It never ceases to impress me!

It’s a very good place for spending time with your children. Those little buildings are so cute and some of them are very real. Besides, they will give you a key to activate some little things, like car will be running on the road, thundering, cutting the tree... and it’s pretty cool that they switch day and night in few minutes

Wow! Gulliver's Gate is amazing, and I really enjoyed my visit here. I got to see a little version of cities in different countries. I can see the plane flying over the airport, some water and waves which looks like real water, and trains that are going around places. It is really entertaining and highly recommended for a family outing!

Quite a unique and remarkable experience. Our kids (aged 6&7)loved it. Beautiful, detailed and more educational than I expected.

Easily spent four hours at the location. Well worth the trip. So many details to see in each diarama /city.

This place was a hoot. I stumbled upon it for something to do before my flight and gave it a go. I was a little sceptical at first as entry is slightly steep compared to some other museums, but once in it was great. The little Easter eggs hidden everywhere, the attention to detail, animations, models from around the world. Quite unique and worth a go!

Although I have looked at Lady Liberty from a distance many times, Finally I decided to hop on a ferry and spend some time at looking at lady liberty close up.

You can purchase tickets online and obviously they have different tour levels, purchasing online will save you a lot of time and purchasing the reserve ticket will also get you in the priority boarding queue. I purchased them right from my phone once I saw the line to purchase tickets. 

The line waiting for an empty ferry is actually quite long on a daily basis, they do have more than one ferry transporting back and forth which makes the line move a little faster. There is only so much room on the ferry and on a hot day, the wait can be miserable in the sun so be sure to squeeze into the crowd when boarding the boat to ensure you're part of the cut off, having to wait for the next ferry. 

The ferry ride is relaxing and on a hot day can help to cool you off. Looking at lady upon approach to the island liberty closeup is something quite spectacular and considering the difficulty they faced in getting the foundation of the statute initially built, its even more amazing closeup. 

The tour will also take you to Ellis Island which is well worth the time and extremely informational. The old hospital on the island is also really cool to see and they do have a tour which would allow you to see parts of the old hospital which I at some point will have to do. I thoroughly enjoy spending time on Ellis island not just for the history lesson and opportunity to get a close up of the awesome architecture but also just sit back and look across the water at the magnificent skyline. 

This is a good relaxing way to spend the afternoon.
Cheers!

What a fantastic place, the wax model's are very serial. All of the staff that we met really made us feel welcome , 10/10 for customer service, the team are a credit to the company. The game and the 4d short  marvel movie were a great fun experience. Then the fair games at the end are brilliant too, i won myself a panda teddy which is very good quality. I'd highly recommend visiting this place for families as it's a great day out. I would definitely visit again if i ever get the opportunity to visit New York. Great photo opportunities too.

Great fun, kid friendly. Loved being able to take pictures. Give yourself around one and a half to two hours to explore. Elevators take you out at the end, so make sure you are done before getting on. Discounts available online and it's easy to purchase online. Discount available when buying Ripley's believe it or not, at the same time.

We all enjoyed our visit. Waxworks were very lifelike, scarily so. We were there approximately 2 hours and there was plenty to see. Youngest son had the wax hand made which he liked and eldest son went on the zombie experience which he loved. Good value for money, for NY anyway.

My first time in NYC and this place is a must see. I loved seeing all my favorite stars all in one place. And yes you can take the best pictures with the figures. I just happen to have one of the last pictures with Puff Daddy before someone destroyed it! Love that! History! I was upset I couldn't find my Whitney Houston. I believe she was put up? That would have made my trip! Hopefully there will be a next time!

Consistently great. I like to just get a gyro plate, but the gyro chicken mix is good too. The price ($8) is great for the amount of food you get (for NYC anyway) and it’s always so damn satisfying. They’ve perfected white sauce, although their hot sauce is not for the faint of heart. Seriously, I’m someone who really loves hot sauce and spicy food, but their hot sauce is next level hot. Do not slather it all over your food without trying it first. Make sure to step up to the cart with cash.

Is this same as Gyro? It seems pretty similar to me. I ate chicken and I personally liked local Gyro better. I don’t think its worth it for me to commute 30-40 min. + waiting in a line (may vary on time, but other than “bad” weather most of time there usually a line) to seat anywhere on the street to eat this food.  I tried it to tell people that I did. I guess I set my expectation too high.

It's become a classic for the area. It's a good food for a good price. $8 will get you a platter that most people won't finish, you're probably best off sharing if you don't eat a lot. If there's a line, don't worry it moves quickly. Not many places to sit in the area so keep that in mind.

I can't preach enough how good Halal Guys is. If you haven't been there before, you need to go asap. A staple in NYC, and at a ton of street corners around the midtown to central park area, the portions are enormous and the prices are cheap. Great quality, always fresh, very nice people working at each stand. Combo platter is always the way to go,so much delicious food!

Great food, quick service, great price. 

I get the lamb platter every. single. time. Red sauce, 2x white sauce, the works. They know what they're doing. No one goes there for friendly service, the men are so furiously working to move the line along and pump out delicious food...that's what's important and that's OK for a food truck experience. 

Lines are always long. It moves quickly and it's worth it. It is so hard to resist getting this for lunch every day. Especially when someone brings it into the office. So many wonderful aromas. They really are the best in the business...or at least in the area!

Nice large casino floor with a lot of games to play and a lot of slot machines. The floor is level and easy to navigate. There is a good court right outside the casino floor and a few places that you can access from the casino. There is a poker room here. There are outlets upstairs and downstairs here as well and kid's quest is where you can check in your children to play while you go to the casino which is nice. The only issue I saw was that there are a lot of people that come over on buses that sleep at the slot machines and when they are not sleeping they are bumping into you or blocking the walkways because they don't pay attention to where they are going.

It was easy to fine and beautiful scenic drive! I gave it ⭐⭐⭐ because people still smoke on non smoking area, being a non smoker I only gamble on non smoking area. And they don't have free soda machine like Horseshoe & Hollywood.

Really large casino with music on the weekends and all you can eat lobster some nights as well. It took me a while to realize those glowing orange “carrots” hanging from the ceiling are drippings of steel. 

Worth a visit, and maybe the highlight of Bethlehem, PA. It certainly was my highlight since I won quite a bit!

Good luck!

I love the Sands, it is clean, staff is polite and very helpful, we were treated with care and even had an upgrade on rooms for my Birthday to Presidents suit, it was sweet. Love the casino we win all the time it is worth going a distant to get there. Great experience.

It was a nice experience! To Smokey for me because I don't smoke but I accompanied a friend and had a nice time! I love the chairs in the high-roller room! If you ever want to sell them I'm down for 2 and if you really want to be generous Take 6! LOL! Nice time!
Simple delicious food. I love their kebab halabi which is lamb kebabs in tomato sauce. Boureka is worth trying too

Wonderful restaurant giving us a glimpse into the Middle Eastern Druze community. After spending time learning their culinary style in Israel I learned that this is one of the few places to find it outside of that area of the world. Staff is kind and gives you plenty of time to enjoy the food and the atmosphere.
I like that this place is BYOB and they serve Israeli Druze food, which is otherwise very difficult to find in this country. Order some of their wonderful breads (you can see them in the window).
Incredible food! The goat cheese and spinach bread was to die for!! Lots of vegetarian appetizers which made a great veggie combo meal. Our server was great!

Wonderful place for lunch or dinner - we loved the brunch specials!   The Druze breakfast was excellent, as were the hummus platter (4 amazing varieties) and perfectly spiced Bourekas (meat pies).    Service was very attentive and helpful, and we enjoyed a filling yet extremely healthy meal.   A great place for vegetarians, but many options for meat lovers as well.   Our new favorite Middle Eastern place in the City!   Try it out - you won't be disappointed!!!!

Shelly is amazing. From the moment I sat down I was treated like royalty. Everything here is so fresh and so tasty. The sushi pizza is literally to die for. I love a good sushi pizza and have tried it all over the city and I assure you you can’t get a better one than here. I also had the sashimi sampler and I couldn’t be happier. Can’t wait to be back for sure.
Very good! Fresh sushi, and small quiet atmosphere. Great place off the hustle and crowds of Broadway and Times Square.
Delightful service and delicious sushimi!  Also great prices!
Good prices, very nice food
Always super quick for pick up!! Great spot in Hell’s Kitchen

Tasty breakfast. I had the omelette and I didn't regret it. Everything on the grill looked delicious. The place was packed and there was a line by the time we left. This is also the place where Jerry Seinfeld and Larry David used to eat breakfast and apparently came up for the idea of Seinfeld. It sort of looks like the diner from the show.

Long line but went quickly. DELICIOUS!! Tables are close to each other but the service was great for so many people and super quick!! We had our food within 15 minutes of ordering. Good prices for the area too!

Great and reliable diner with huge selection of nearly anything you'd crave!  Perfect for late night excursions, too!  The food was very good and the service was spot on. I had delicious onion rings and the server even brought some extra ones from the kitchen halfway though the meal. Pickles and coleslaw were a nice touch, while we waited for our order. Will definitely return.

What a way to start the day at an American diner!
Westway Diner is clean, efficient, and wholesome. 
I created my own omelette: tomato, onion, mushroom and ham coupled with a cappuccino!
Would love to return for another meal!

Service - 5/5
Ambience - 5/5
Quality - 5/5

This fast paced diner is quite amazing! The hostess said it would take 5 minutes to sit us and literally within a minute they prepped a table for us and took us to our seats. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. He kept checking on our table to make sure that everything was going well. I had the turkey and cheddar sandwich and they do not hold out, it was stacked with so many layers of turkey and cheddar, you won't be disappointed. If you are in the city check them out; and this is where the Seinfeld show was brainstormed and the idea took off!!

Went there with my husband and kids.First of all I thought this restaurant would be fancy, but I was disappointed. The decor is old and dated. Secondly, the main dish that we ordered didn’t meet our expectations.The guacamole salad and vegetable salad were good, for kids we ordered fries and chicken nuggets, the chicken nuggets was kind of too dry for kids, so they didn’t even eat it. For main dish ( don’t remember what it’s called)had chicken with mashed potatoes, didn’t like it at all. My husband also didn’t like what he ordered. The service is good.
Great food. Very accommodating. We got there a half hour before closing and they hustled so that we could have dinner.
Great experience start to finish. Beautiful atmosphere. Terrific options and really excellent food. Abigael's takes kosher dining from relegation to revelation.

So disappointed!!!!!! I would give zero stars if possible. 
The decor is old and dated. Ugly and doesn’t make any sense. 
The food was atrocious!! Got a bunch of apps and each one smelled funky and lacked any good flavor, any flavor was gross. For an appetizer that was $16 we got one egg roll, like what?! The dessert was made with melted chocolate chips that were burned. I can basically go on and on. The atmosphere was depressing and one waiter for all the tables. So sad.

I have been here before but not in a long time.  From what I remember they have really upped their game. The food was all spectacular and the steak I ordered was one of the best I ever had.  I also had a sushi appetizer and the fish and rice were extremely fresh. As was the newly baked bread.  Absolutely would recommend for elegant dining in a quiet, cozy dining room.  The one thing that you need to be aware of is that to get this quality ain't cheap.  The meal is expensive but you don't feel ripped off because the quality of the food comes through.
Many year's ago I worked at a Ruby Foo's Chinese Restraunt on Pine Ave in Niagara Fall's N. Y. , had great Food, and wonderful owner's and worker's

Good service. Plus that they have a kids menu!!  Call for reservations definitely recommended for busy times.  Had the double pan fried noodles and they were tasty and not too salty.  Pad Thai also good.  Definitely a return visit.

A dinner at Ruby Foo's is guaranteed to be an enjoyable experience. The service was especially great here, and the waiters were clearly well-trained. In general, I loved the modern vibe of the restaurant. It virtually could satisfy everyone - adults, kids, and families. The menu seemed to have lots of good selections that I look forward to coming back and trying in the near future.

A friend and I came here for quick dinner. They ordered a mix of sushi pieces which they really enjoyed. I got the shrimp fried rice which was okay. We split an order for edamame which tasted the same you could get in any Asian restaurant. The food was nothing spectacular but the decor was beautiful and impressive.   I wouldn't go out of way to come again but if I am in the neighborhood and craving Asian food I might pop in for some food and the beautiful decor.

Didn't really like the menu. Not that many options.service was horrible.my sister ordered a salad and they forgot to bring it out until we asked about it. It's looks really nice inside but its just to dark.
Very good Japanese restaurant. Great food and loads of options, all very tasty.

This little place is hard to beat. The chirashi sushi lunch set was a generous portion, high in quality, including the rice, and very fair in price.  The side dishes were equally good.  The service was prompt and friendly. I will be back to try some of their other dishes.
Food Fresh and People friendly
Great food. Slightly pricey
Great quality of menu, excellent service. Highly Recommended.

The concentration of so many great paintings in one place is stunning!  An excellent choice for visitors with limited time although it will still take most of the day to see everything.  Fair warning; disappointed reviewers have noted strict guards so be prepared to check everything into the coat room (including your camera), do not bring young children with you and check the visitor guidelines on the website for other restrictions that you may encounter.  My visit was thoroughly enjoyable but too brief.  I plan to go back as soon as I can return to NYC.

A fabulous collection with free audio. $22 entry per adult. Good multiple short talks available from knowledgeable staff. The only thing I was disappointed by is that apart from the interior garden you are not allowed to take photographs. The Collection is not overwhelming like it is at the MIT but there is still plenty to look at for a good two to three hours in this place including some absolutely marvellous works by Rembrandt, Turner, De Goya and so many others famous ones also Vermeer.

Arriving at The Frick collection wasn't to hard. Just make sure you go to the right entrance. Inside they have a coat check at the entrance which is great. You also have an option for a video guide. No photos are allowed except in the fountain area which is awesome imagine being in a mansion with nice collections of art in historical rooms!

Astounding. The tickets are $22 on Sundays but I would pay $50 for the experience. You must go to this if you fancy art museums. Takes about 2 hours to see everything, but I would suggest 5-6 hours if you really want to take everything in. The furniture, metalwork, even the architecture serves as a piece which deserves attention and admiration. I would love to be here by myself if I could. 

Phenomenal.

Check out my Twitch Channel: Thunder_Birb

One of my fave musuems. I love the architecture of this Mansion on the upper east side. The art here is just phenomenal. Great hits from different periods. If I were rich, I would want a house like this!

Cohen exhibit opened today. Don't miss it! You'll need a few hours to immerse yourself. The second floor organ installation is amazing.  Take your time, play multiple keys. When you get to the room with the men's choir singing, stay and listen as long as you can stand it before going into the room behind the screen. I laughed out loud with joy!
The Leonard Cohen exhibit was spectacular. And quite poignant. Very much worth a visit.
Beautiful! Amazing! I loved going here with my family and encourage everyone to go. I intend to go again.

Had a great experience here. The museum strikes the right balance between atrocities of the past and optimism for the future. I also highly recommend the Cafe with a fantastic selection of unique fish dishes.

This is perhaps not the worst museum I’ve ever visited, but it’s pretty close. The staff seem thoroughly uninterested in helping visitors have an enjoyable time. But take your jacket off in the galleries and they’ll be all over you to put it back on. Rarely have I seen a museum with a more inane rules.

But do the exhibits make up for that? Haha, hardly. Many of the exhibits feel more like collections of high-school art projects than serious works of art.

Two stars is being generous. A real disappointment.
Lovely space. Amazing programs. Gorgeous. I attended a film and discussion of the Triplets movie with friends. Spectacular event.

Perhaps one of the most indescribably beautiful houses of worship in the entire world. If you ever get to go, even if you sit alone, one of two things will happen. You will either get closer to your inner self..........or closer to God. A human triumph of religious architecture.
It place where you can meet many educated people and participate in many interesting events
Enjoyed services.

While the synagogue is beautiful, the services are cold, little feeling of being in a  Jewish house of worship. I come from the oldest reform Temple west of the Mississippi, but even there, you feel a Jewish connection. We sing our prayers together in Hebrew; we try to partake in the service. Here, I felt the last leg of anything Jewish. As a reform Jew with a history of 4 generations in California, I left here sad; I felt no sense of community, a service so void of anything that touched my heart as a Jew.  Take  away the magnificent building, to me, it could be any place of worship..... Jewish? unfortunately not.

Amazing burgers, cooked to perfection.  Their Green Flash IPA on tap us my go to beer.  Their fries are amazing and one of the few places that offer steak cut fries (and get that fresh garlic on it).  Anytime I'm on Solano and need a good burger, i look no further.  Always friendly staff and even when its busy, you get your food in a timely manner.  Love this place!

An excellent showing by a community based restaurant.  We shall start with the service.  It was good... bordering on excellent.  Ambiance was nice.  Food was excellent and plentiful. The voodoo sauce mixed with blue cheese added depth and fantastic sneak up on you heat. The large fry fed 3 people with left overs. All in all a solid good meal.  I will return.

Received attentive, if not nervous like, service and serving classically good Barney's Burgers  food. 
Perhaps it was the layout, the old athmosphere, the overly strong clinging perfume smell or the sticky feeling on the table but I cannot see myself returning to this particular Barney's on Solano.
So very good.  Best burger joint in the bay area

Barney's makes some of the best burgers I've had. Consistently. It's hard to describe exactly what they do so right, except that they capture the essence of an American burger. The classic Barney's Burger is big, juicy, slightly blackened, with fresh lettuce, tomato, and onion, on a perfect sesame bun. It's not edgy and over the top like a $25 artisanal gastropub burger. It's just damned good, and I keep coming back.
Awesome hot dogs. Never had anything like it before, one of a kind. Owner/cook is fast and friendly, loved the experience. Definitely worth the 40 minute drive. And the wait in line.

Hot dog did not disappoint!

This is not a complaint, really, but I got far more Tater tots than I bargained for. Order was far bigger than I expected, so I wish they had a smaller size that was more like a side dish to a meal rather than a portion size that could essentially be its own meal.

OMG it's a New York institution on the east side. You've got to try it hot dogs cooking on an open grill all day long so good. Always busy always friendly always a lot of people try one plane and try one with their mustard.

The best hotdogs in the world served at incredible prices almost immediately along with the perfect ice cold tropical drinks by some of the sweetest guys in NY. Beloved by celebrity chefs & everyone else. Just go. You won't regret it. Unless you're a vegan- in which case just have the juice - still awesome.
Great hot dogs and fresh papaya drinks. Can get packed with people so try to have your order and money ready to go before you go inside. You can see some menu items from outside.

Such a cute, amazing bake shop filled with delicious homemade and refreshing recipes! You can tell their cupcakes and are pies are fresh because they melt right in your mouth and they don’t taste processed like most cupcakerys in the city. Red velvet, blackout, swirl, sweet potatoes pie and cheesecake are phenomenal and will light up your taste buds with a little 💃. Don’t wait, support them!

TLDR Service was fantastic, small cute place and price was okay. Long version: Had steady flow of customers. Selection was standard fare, and taste was good. Staff was fast to get orders filled. Cakes were not overly sweet but IMO Small Cakes had moister cakes. Great service, nice price and was tasty. I would return to try other flavors.

When I visited, there were two super nice and friendly guys. Sadly they were out of their key lime pie as we came late in evening, but we had delicious pecan pie.  Definitely met my southern high standards. Super cute decour. Love that you can enjoy your pastry or pie there too.

This place is the best! Everything they have in there is fresh and worth the price. I cross the GW when I want real cheesecake, NO cheesecake compare to theirs. Red velvet and Brooklyn blackout are very satisfying. Anytime I go is a long line.

I discovered Two Little Red Hens bakery years ago upon the recommendation of a close friend. Years later it’s still one of my favorite bakeries in the city! The cakes and pastries never disappoint. There is yet an item that I’ve tasted that I did not thoroughly enjoy. They make divine birthday cakes, cupcakes and pies! A must try! And while you wait, get a piece of the coffee crumb cake. YUM!!!

Great atmosphere, the interior of the house is adorned with beautiful murals. The one waitress /bartender became overwhelmed by the crowd that followed me. As someone who lived in Germany for a couple of years, I can't speek to the menus authenticity. I had a Reuben that wasn't grilled and the fries lacked any season. A small bit of research will give you insight, I asked for mayo for the fries and was disappointed by the consistency! Surely they could do better, I look forward to a better experience on my next visit.

This place is AMAZING for drinks and food. I'm not a huge beer person, but this place has a ton of cocktails that are strong and delicious.

In terms of food recommendations.

Loved this place the first time we went but this time it was terrible. The food was over cooked to the point that it was hard to chew threw our potato pancakes. The saurbrauten was dried out and chewy as well and tasted like basic beef roast with basic jarred beef gravy on it. For how much we paid for two people, I expected it to be better.

Wow. What an awesome experience. I've heard from a few people that this was great, but it's nice to have confirmed that myself. The main floor is the diner and bar area. The second floor is a mini club/bar, with cover charge, and they even have a basement area, though I was not down there. 

I loved the German pub asthetics and will say it's a nice place to get together with friends for a few beers and such. 

*Do note though, their German food fare is not offered after 10 pm and is not listed on the website as such, but our server was nice enough to still put in our order at 10 minutes after.

I actually like Heidelberg, but after my latest visit it's just so frustrating.  Four reasons are costing them three stars:

1) Service has historically been pretty iffy.  This latest time, our server completely forgot to put in our food order.
2) That would have been fine, but then don't try to blame it on the kitchen.  I don't care how backed up they are, there's no reason 1 appetizer takes an hour, especially when other tables sat later got served first.  Just own it dude.  Oh and don't try to charge me for food I never received.
3) Maybe service would be better overall if management staffed more than 2 bartenders and didn't have 1 of them also wait tables.  On a night of a major football game.  Seriously.
4) Beer prices are really high.  $20 for 3 pints?  What.

Only get crepe cakes. You must try this in all its glory! The layers are paper thin with the perfect subtle cream in between each carefully crafted layer. Take a second to enjoy cutting into the 20-odd crepe layers, it’s music in motion. And yea it’s $9 per slice... but 9 bucks is worth every bite of this. Just think of the complexity of building this baby, it’s worth it!

This place used to be amazing. But have had it a few times in the last few months and I think the quality is changing. They put way too much cream now. The crepe cake used to be light. It feels way more heavy in the last few months. They need to lighten their fingers on layering the cream.
Their Mille crepes are the best. Have tried the signature and the seasonal chestnut flavor and it was beyond excellence! A very small place tho so be prepared to wait in line.

Lady M contrary to what Judith Sutton says, does not serve pizza. They serve the most delectable original cakes and an assortment of delicious sandwiches. Upper Eastside small and narrow but lovely atmosphere. Good teas and coffee's. On the expensive side.

If I could only eat at one bakery for the rest of my life (for free. Emphasis on the free), this would be it. Cakes are not too sweet, and very light, if that's what you're going for.

Recommended must-try: The mille crepes are the fluffiest cakes I have ever had - they have around 20 layers! My personal favorite is the green tea, but the signature vanilla and chocolate are also incredible. If I magically won the lottery, the immediate first thing I would do is buy a slice of every cake flavor. I personally prefer their mille crepe cakes over checkers cakes, but their checkers cakes are also incredibly moist, with icing within each checkered layer. 

5/5: The only downside is the price. Absolutely worth trying at least once though!

Excellent food. The tables are very close, so if you like eavesdropping this place is perfect. We sat on the patio with beautiful vines and plants. It was a very cold February day but cozy and warm with the heaters and close tables. Staff was professional and pleasant.

My husband and I had lunch here immediately following our elopement in central park. The food was amazing & the atmosphere was so cozy and romantic. We couldn't have picked a better place. It will forever hold a special place in my heart.

Over hyped . The interior is beautiful and the wine list is nice but as for the food, The presentation is very weak , the sauce for the short rib dish I had tasted like it was out of a can. Quality of meat itself tasted like it came out of vacuum sealed packaging . I really don’t get how everyone on here is saying it’s the best Italian food they had . I worry for them because I’m afraid they don’t have good taste in food period , or worse the review are false . My takeaway with this is , go for the vibes and drinks but don’t expect “the best “ Italian food . I’ve had better Italian food at an Irish pub than this place 🤷🏽‍♂️🤷🏽‍♂️🤷🏽‍♂️
Perfect date night location. Intimate, great wine, better food. The atmosphere is very authentic and the back covered patio is beautiful. Highly recommend.

LOVE this place! On any given night it is filled with people, that’s how good it is. The inside is decorated so cute, great for a romantic night or a gathering with friends. They are open til 3-4 even on weeknights. Food is absolutely delicious, not to mention the WINE. I’m convinced I could get any glass and love it.
Sempre tem vouchers para ir ao cinema pagando mais barato.
A minha primeira experiência  foi Boa  mais a segunda uma dor de cabeça. Comprei ontem  o cartão aprovado e diz que a compra está em análise. Ligo e não atende.fica dificil

Não possui um sistema de avaliação dos cupons, e nem de comentários, realizei uma compra, da qual o estabelecimento não funciona aberto ao público, funciona por meio de entregas terceirizadas, além de não ter discriminado na descrição do regulamento que não pode retirar no local do estabelecimento, uma vez que o local não é aberto ao público, aparenta ser uma residência.

Não atende telefone, tampouco gera cupom de oferta comprada e já debitada no cartão. Fica impossível estabelecer contato com a equipe Barato Coletivo pra resolver qualquer problema desse jeito. Estou me sentindo lesada!

Oi me chamo Marcicleia, fiz uma compra pelo Barato Coletivo no dia 13/12/2017 (quarta-feira), referente a 1 Torta Doce para 40 pessoas + 400 Salgados + 1 Torta de Frango (1,5kg) + 1 Refri 2L + 100 Tortinhas no valor de R$99,90, mas a empresa não disponibiliza do Kit festa na data em que desejo, e por tal motivo solicitei através do formulário no Site Barato Coletivo, o estorno da minha compra no mesmo dia, e desde o dia 13/12/2017 venho entrando em contato com o site através do nº 85.3055-0705 e sempre me falam que irá ser resolvido no mesmo dia, só que hoje dia 18/12/2017 ainda não estornaram o valor, ficam a penas na promessa, grande descaso e falta de consideração, pois se tivesse fora do prazo de 7 dias estipulado para cancelamento, com certeza negaria o estorno, já estou me aborrecendo pois o estorno de um valor é feito em menos de minutos, qual a dificuldade disso? Por qual motivo ainda não foi feito e atendido o meu pedido?

Great place!! Food is amazing!! My friends and I did a bottomless brunch and it was great. Sonia our server was the best!! She kept the food and drinks coming and was super accommodating to our large party. Definitely somewhere I would recommend and keep coming back to!!

Lovely Spanish room with young patrons. The server, Vicente, was very attentive and attentive -- and the coffee was deeply rich and earthy. The food was beautifully presented and colorful . The tamale was a bit tough but and the carnitas tacos were delicious.  The happiness of the ambiance and affable waiters made the brunch memorable. I'd come back any time to imbibe in endless food brunch option.

Was tonight for happy hour. Very nice mood for a Friday night. The drinks was on point. Only thing is you have to wait a little while to order and order just that busy. The chicken nachos was very good would visit again.

We sat at the bar side of the place and had 2 cocktails, 2 glasses of wine and a bowl of nachos - all for less than $50 (including tip). The atmosphere was good and what we had was decent. I'd recommend
Nice restaurant for a friendly time with friends. Dishes can be shared and you can have a festive sample of great flavors. Great  service  too!
Nice building
My favorite building in New York City, on of the best buildings ever build in NYC!!!
Exterior is something you seldom see.
Spectacular building to stand and stare at
Es el edificio que describe el libro “La invención de un asesinato” de Jed Rubenfeld (en el libro le cambian el nombre El Balmoral)

Unbelievable. Tried to open a business checking account and it took four visits, one which lasted over two hours. It seems they always require more forms that aren't mentioned at the previous visit. They put your account on "probation" for 90 days and then decide if you get a debit card. Don't bother with this joke of a bank. I walked across the street to TDBank and opened an account in 30 minutes.

I have genuinely loved Apple bank since it was Emigrant bank and I have been with them for several years. I enjoyed all of my experiences up until today. DO NOT go to the 72nd St location. They have the absolute worst staff I have ever experienced. A   " Manager " named  " Sheila Gordon " has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. Sheila Gordon is beyond confrontational, rude, incompetent and just clearly dislikes her job. I have no clue how someone of her caliber could obtain employment with a company as prestigious as apple bank. She single handily brings down not only the reputation of the bank but also the customer service. Her behavior belongs on the street and not in a bank. She obviously forgot the definition of  “professionalism” or the fact that she works in a bank. AVOID THIS LOCATION.
I feel that my money is safe, besides that employees at apple bank have a excelent customer service skill , specially at 181st branch.
Apple bank was a really friedly experience. I was given my own ersonal advsor who guided me through everything and helped fnd the right loan and repayment method for me :)
How is this bank still here? We left after 30 minutes of waiting and rude customer service

I love coming into this place. There are two massive statues by Fernando Botero that welcome you when you enter the main atrium. Once inside there are many choices to make. You can take the escalator downstairs where there is a Whole Foods location. The main floor has stores by designers such as Hugo Boss, a cigar store and many other cool places to explore. There used to be a Borders Book store on the second level that I would visit regularly. There are now a couple of eateries that are not only real good, but also offer great views of Central Park and Columbus Circle. There are several more levels to explore upstairs and some really fancy restaurants as well. I love how they decorate the main atrium with stars that light up and change colors during the holidays. There's a subway station right across the street and after enjoying a light meal you can use this place as a starting point to explore the city and all it has to offer.

A wonderful center just by Central Park. Fancy stores and several great restaurants. Some of the stores and dining options are quite expensive - but some aren't. Momofuku Noodle Bar offers delicious food, Center bar and other on the higher floors provide the opportunity to sit, relax and enjoy the beautiful view of Columbus Circle and the park.

Beautiful little mall, part of the Mandarin Oriental building. They have hanging glass stars for Christmas which light up to music, on a Columbus Circle backdrop, which is stunning. People at the 3rd floor cafe are way too snobby and you have to buy a full lunch to be seated, even though they call themselves a bakery it seems coffee and pastries at $14 won't cut it. Bathrooms available on every floor and they are clean. Mall has a lot of security.
Nice small mall with variety of high end stores. Restrooms area nice & clean.
Beautiful screening room but CNN Time Warner is moving to Hudson Yards so this place will not be active much longer

Cool museum, it's just a lot smaller than I expected and only hosts rotating exhibits. Don't expect to spend more than 30 minutes here. It's good to pop in if you are in the neighborhood, but not worth a trip to see just the museum. On the positive side, is free to visit.

In its latest version this is a teeny-tiny space that always has a lovely small exhibit of some folk artist or craft type.  I think the larger version lost its funding.  It expands and contracts over the years but I have seen
wonderful artists there that I would never otherwise have been exposed to.  Nice little gift shop also
This place was awesome!! These magnificent carousel animals brought back lovely memories from my childhood!  A must - see!!!

My friend suggested this place to me during a conversation in which we talked about artist blocks, namely the expectations that artists put on themselves when trying to create a work of art. (Seriously, why do we do this? It feels so paralyzing sometimes.)

And what better place to get back that inspiration than a (free!) museum that celebrates folk artists—people who often had no formal training but who still managed to create pieces that resonated with others and that sometimes spoke about larger societal issues?

This museum is small, I’ll grant you that. However, they use what little space they have well. There are revolving exhibits; my friend and I were there to see John Dunkley’s “Neither Day nor Night” and Paa Joe’s “Gates of No Return.” I agree with previous reviewers that I wouldn’t make this place the main focus of a day trip. It’s a bit too small for that. However, if you pair it with lunch or dinner at nearby eateries, it makes for a nice, relaxing trip. If you’re an artist or art appreciator, I’m sure you will find a few things within the exhibits to make it worthwhile. =)

What really enchanted me were the cabinets near the entrance, where you could temporarily store your belongings or coat. The images of art on each cabinet correspond to an image attached to a key so that when you return, there is no confusion as to where you stored your stuff. I loved this small touch; if only they printed the name of the artist and piece on the back of each card!
See amazing hand work exhibits and free Wednesday afternoon Swing-Jazz with Bill Wurtzel-guitar!

A great place to visit in New York. A single day is not enough to explore the museum since it is really huge and is a storehouse of knowledge. One can learn about the theory of evolution, animals, their habitats etc. It's the perfect place to bring students as it provides immense knowledge through life sized models, equipments, sculptures etc. One can find a variety of manuscripts here. The museum also has interactive exhibits which attract a lot of young explorers. This place is often visited by families. One definitely has to visit this place twice or thrice to get the most out of it. If you are a history buff, do visit this place! It's phenomenal.

An absolute national treasure. We spent nearly a full day there and we couldn't begin to scratch the surface of what was there. A beautifully curated and maintained gallery of so many wonders, human and geological and animal and mineral and stellar...

The dinosaurs are, of course, magnificent. And the special exhibits are absolutely worth it. Such a delight.

I enjoyed my visit to the American Museum of Natural History. There was a mixture of information I already knew, and things that I learned. The exhibits I think were more geared towards children and teens, but I still enjoyed them. 

I believe there’s a scavenger hunt that you can sign up for, which would be a good idea for a corporate bonding activity.

Ticket prices are a bit high, and I feel like I got enough out of it with one visit, so I probably will not return.

This place is just phenomenal, I would suggest you park in the parking garage for the day and get there early . Where do I begin , I first had the opportunity to go and check out the massive planetarium it was so surreal. Since ,I went with family and friends we hit up most of the exhibits since there are 4 floors . I would suggest you get a map and plan accordingly and bring lunch you’re going to need a break .They do have a coffee and gift shop available in the museum . Also a plus , Central Park is just across the street for an nice walk,Which we took on the 90 degree day & felt nice and breezy their was also a nice water spray park located there as well. Overall, this is a great place to bring your family whether you live in or out of state for a great educational experience or day trip ! :)

Well worth the membership. From their website:

Become a Member today and immediately enjoy these benefit highlights:

Unlimited General Admission and FREE tickets to special exhibitions (currently Unseen Oceans) per visit for up to 2 adults (a Family Membership can include a caregiver as one of the adults and covers up to 4 children)
Access to a Member entrance
Previews of new special exhibitions before they open to the public (T. rex: The Ultimate Predator Member Preview Days March 8–10)
Additional FREE tickets and discounts on 2D and 3D giant-screen films (currently Backyard Wilderness), the Hayden Planetarium Space Show, the seasonal Butterfly Conservatory, and other Museum purchases
And your membership is 100% tax-deductible

I've always wanted to visit St John the Divine since high school. If you haven't been there, it's totally worth the trip uptown.  The architecture is amazing. It's a combination of Gothic and Romanesque because the cathedral built in 2 different periods. We took the tour up to the roof and loved it. If you get claustrophobic or dizzy with heights stay on the ground floor. Also, you have to be healthy enough to make the climb up steep narrow steps. It was pretty high up there.. it's completely worth it.

BREATHTAKING. The most glorious cathedral I have ever set eyes on. The largest Episcopal/Anglican Cathedral in North America as well as the largest Stained Glass Rosette Window. 

So many spectacular details, countless stained glass windows, sculptures, and mini chapels. I spent 2 hours wandering, taking it all in and photographing so many beautiful things.  An architectural and historical dream.

DEFINITELY WORTH A VISIT and the $10 entrance fee! Not in the usual tourist area as it is in the Upper West side of Manhattan, off of the North West corner of Central Park. 

Highly recommended!

Cathedral of Saint John the Divine, 성요한성당이네요. 아직도 공사가 진행중이다고 하니 정말 대단합니다. Designed in 1888 and begun in 1892, the cathedral has undergone radical stylistic changes and interruption of construction by the two World Wars. Originally designed in the Byzantine Revival-Romanesque Revival styles, the plan was changed after 1909 to a Gothic Revival design. After a large fire destroyed part of the North Transept and the organ on December 18, 2001, the Cathedral was formally rededicated in November 2008 after the completion of extensive renovations to the Cathedral and its organ. It remains unfinished, with construction and restoration a continuing process

This cathedral is one of the most amazing buildings I've seen in my life... It's a majestic and awesome place. The fountain alone is worth seeing alone. They have a soup kitchen that is available on Sundays at 10am... St Paul the Divine... Indeed

What can you say except be in awe of the magnificence and sacredness of this space. I have visited and attended services countless times, but we were there seeing the Paul Winter Winter Solstice celebration  with friends.  What an exquisite and breathtaking experience. The performance fit the space perfectly.

Statue of Shinran Shonin which survive explosion of atomic bomb in Hirosima. We have visited NY and this place was at the top off my list places i wanted to see. Stands as remainder off horrible tragedy.

念仏の声を世界に 子や孫に
世の中安穏なれ 仏法ひろまれ
Está un poco escondida. El acceso se realiza por el portal que está al lado.
Service is gruff, even by New York standards
Hi, international student need free PhD, is it possible
Campus is really inspirational and a great place to spend your evening and think about anything. Compared to the campuses of other US universities, they definitely need more trees.

Criticized for being a revolving door for graduate degrees with the "Columbia University" name attached, I can see that for many people. There are a lot of good programs, but it is easily to get bogged down as it is a graduate school of education, and not the traditional Ph.D. programs like other universities where doctoral students are fully funded to be full time students and lecturers.
I spent the best time of my life when I was a student there.

I'm a Mannes alum, B.M. ,1993 composition...One of the best choices I have ever made. It's an educational institution like no other, in quality of faculty, ensembles, student/teacher ratio, fantastic performers, and now new facilities in Union Square (great place to live!).  Best of luck

Mannes is a deeply supportive, fully professional environment.  It provides top-quality training, with real interest in the individual student.  The Preparatory Department is one of the best resources anywhere, for developing young talents, as well as allowing kids to explore music in a more general way.  The college produces strong, energized musicians with real personal authority.
An innovative institution with traditional values
I love Mannes❤️
Proud to be an Alumni

it gr8 i r8 8/8 m8
but also REOPEN THE FIRST FLOOR 24 HOURS
dat all thx

Statue of Shinran Shonin which survive explosion of atomic bomb in Hirosima. We have visited NY and this place was at the top off my list places i wanted to see. Stands as remainder off horrible tragedy.

念仏の声を世界に 子や孫に
世の中安穏なれ 仏法ひろまれ
Está un poco escondida. El acceso se realiza por el portal que está al lado.
A nice spot to view what Cleveland has to offer , nice rest stop with little bit of history about it .
Amazing monument. Extremely detailed. Would like to go in the catacombs.

Perhaps one of the finest Civil War monuments erected in the North or South. Memorial for 9,000 plus Cuyahoga County soldiers killed from 1861-1865. Incredible hand carved marble & awesome bronze sculpture by the noted architect & artist Levi Scofield. Do not miss this American treasure when in Cleveland.
Very cool random monument in the middle of downtown. Went in to get out of the humidity for a few minutes but ended up staying and enjoying the displays and history!
If you're from Cleveland, visiting, or just passing through, you have got to check out the soldiers and sailors monument! Make sure to be on the look out for tunnel tours underneath it!

Man, on one hand, they were the best bagels I've had in the city and they will inspire me to go forth and try one of New York's most famous product. On the other hand, it can be a hit or a miss. The first time I came, I was blown away and that was likely because I came when they had freshly made my sesame bagel. It was crisp, it was tender and soft, and it wasn't dry. The egg salad was warmed just by being near that freshly made piece of heaven. Then the next time I came... well, different experience all together. 

I didn't think I had to toast my bagel (I didn't the first time) and I chose the chicken salad. Maybe it was too early in the morning when I came that day, but the bagel was kinda cold and harder, and the chicken salad was still icy. It wasn't my best breakfast. 

Still, the bagel isn't bad... 

Don't expect service. They have tons of customers and they just want you in and out.

Delicious bagels! The everything bagel with chive and garlic cream cheese is amazing. Bagels are crisp, chewy and have awesome flavor. Be aware that they are cash only. Usually pretty crowded but you don't wait long. Very limited seating.

Absolute Bagels is an upper west side staple. I've been living here for about 7 years and I can tell you it's an excellent place for a classic NYC bagel. I bring friends and family here when they visit and they love it. I would recommend coming earlier on in the morning to miss the line and to have a great breakfast. It's a little cramped in terms of eating inside the establishment but it's great to take a breakfast sandwich and coffee to go and then head to Central Park on a nice day.

In my opinion, one of the best bagels in NYC. Depending on the spread, the price of an individual bagel can start to creep up but is still easily worth the cost. There was a line when I went, but it moves fast. Limited seating. Very generous cream cheese servings. Would recommend this bagel shop to everybody!

I did not realize how popular this place was- so beware and plan accordingly. We arrived to a line wrapped outside of the building. The line moved so quickly that I didn’t notice! The bagels are great, but they charge extra for toasting them. Also, they only take cash so make sure you bring some with you!

A very nice space for a date.
You get a great deal with the pre-set menu. The portions are great and you can get unlimited refills for the same price.
After dinner, they serve one dessert dish which is also included on your bill.
The staff was very nice and they refilled my glads of water regularly.
If you are looking for an affordable dinner for two, this is the place!

Always different.  Most days I love all of it,  every time I love most of it,  even if one dish isn't my favorite, there are many other options. The staff is super nice and we're always happy we went there.
Great lunch.  Good flavors, good value.
Came here for lunch with my boyfriend. Food is light and flavorful. It's a good lunch deal since you can get refills. If you want healthy food with a good price, this is the spot!

How could you not love this place?!? If you love curry and vegetarian, this is the place. Every time I come here, I leave with a happy face. Simple menu and delicious food. Also they refill any food you want more with no extra charge.

Good cheap option for hot dogs. The dogs are grilled and have a classic NY taste. The actual hot dogs and toppings are good. The bread tastes a little cheap. Drinks are mostly colored sugar water with some semblance of different flavors. Still good for my hot fog fix especially during the Spring and Summer.

Gray's Papaya has been around for longer than I can remember and for good reason. 

The hot dogs are grilled to perfection with ample condiments and the tropical drinks are refreshing and the prices are still reasonable after all these years and given their location. Sure it is a grubby hole in the wall, but that is part of it's real New Yorker's charm.

There is nothing like it on a summer day after a long walk in Central Park or up or down Broadway. If I am in the area, I always make a stop

Whoa! I knew this place was legendary but the hot dogs just don’t look like they are going to be amazing. Oh, but they are. Delicious, snappy dog. Spicy, tangy onion sauce. We each ate two, but I coulda tossed back a few more.

Always the best! This spot is open 24*7 hours, making it an excellent breakfast choice. (Call me crazy.) Lines get long through the day, but move fast. Toppings are extra and totally worth the cents. And must get the papaya drink, although warning: I think it has dairy. The vibe is classic with posters covering every inch of vertical space and paper fruit hanging from the ceiling. Never changes a bit. CASH ONLY!! Five dollars should be more than enough per person though.

Awesome hot dog experience! Skip the sketchy hot dog carts on the street. For about the same price, get NY's #1 hot dog! Plus, the value meals come with their awesome juice! Spectacular! My wife and I loved them!
Fresh, healthy, delicious food and my go-to for lunch. Haven for a vegetarian! Try 201 & 202 daily specials. This is a unique restaurant that offers a perfect break from the craziness of life.
Real simple food. No fancy stuff, no oil and heavy spices. Just really healthy food.

I had the 202 Lunch Deal with Veggies. It tasted great and only costed 7$.
Ambiente could be better and the perso behind the counter could have put on a smile, but overall I was very statisfied. Great place for students to grab a balanced meal, especially vegans.

There is a hard working, talented and compassionate human being making wonderful food here. It is simple, not over-priced, honest and fresh, made from scratch, original recipes. I’ve been going to this restaurant for 10+ years and I am still caught by surprise with new dishes that reflect Hamid’s lifelong learning of cooking. He aces the meat and vegetarian option. And, in case you were wondering, yes, the man behind the counter is called Hamid!

Definitely one of the best place to eat in Champaign-Urbana. Jerusalem serves middle-eastern food, essentially Lebanese.
Healthy and inexpensive from meat, salad, sandwich, falafel, hummus to vegetarian dishes. Lamb shank is excellent. Best Baklava! Highly recommended.
France in New York reminds me of them wonderful French bistros.. Excellent food & excellent service I highly recommend you check it out. And you don't need your passport to go

Jose, our waiter, took such great care of us.  Took a the time to get to know us, made sure everything was perfect, he anticipated our needs; felt like he was reading our minds!  He makes a killer Old Fashion!  Thanks Jose for making our night!

I have had lunches and dinners here on a fairly regular basis since 2016.  I have never been as disappointed as I was with tonight's dinner and service.  The server was someone who I had never seen before and I hope to not have again.  I typically order a Diet Coke and it is served from the bar so I know that the house is making a big profit when charging 3.50 per glass.  I normally don't mind because I get refills and get charged once.  Tonight, not only did I have to ask, twice, for the initial drink, he never bothered to check on us, I had to flag him down for a (single) refill and then when he brought the bill, I discovered that I had been charged for that refill.  7 bucks for two glasses of Diet Coke is outrageous, even for the Upper West side of NYC.

To add to the mess from tonight, I ordered a half chicken, I got a part of a let and a bit of breast... Not the whole thing.  Now, I don't blame the server for that but I do blame him for this - I asked for a substitute of vegetables INSTEAD of the mashed potatoes that typically come with the chicken, normally I get a double size portion of vegetables, which I happily pay a couple dollars extra for.  Tonight, I got a single portion of asparagus which I was charged the same thing as when there's a substitute! 

Additionally, the server came to the table not at all after taking our order.  He made no attempt to check on us, no refills of water, never asked if we wanted dessert, basically he did nothing but scribble down our order.  He's the tall blonde with a kind of heavy accent - not a French accent though.  Avoid him if you can! (Yes, I did tip him, I just didn't give me my usual 20%.)

 All in all, the lack of proper service and the other mistakes will make me think twice before I go back, especially if this server is still working there.

We work around the corner and always come here.

They consistently deliver on great service and quality food.

Friday afternoons is the best time to attend.
Great brunch. Food, service, ambiance all top notch.

Food was fantastic. Came for a birthday celebration. Was surprised with a sticky toffee pudding for dessert that was delicious. Restaurant was clean, with a comfortable atmosphere. Will definitely return.

Excellent food ! We went with a wedding party group of 12. We did wait about 1hr for our food. They had a good many people in there.  However, the staff was excellent and kept our drinks filled and fresh warm bread.  This is the second time we've been and have enjoyed it. I got the breaded chicken breast, stuffed with artichoke and provolone, topped with a creamy red pepper sauce. Hubby got the chicken parmesan and our friend got the prime rib with Yorkshire pudding.
Great place for a good dinner. Great place to have a party.

Food is delicious, pricey but quality is there. The interior is nicely designed and has more of a romantic ambience. Parking is very limited so that might become an issue. View is beautiful if you get a window seat with the view of the river.
Good food, do I need to say more?
Excellent food, decently priced and if you can't wait till you get home you can dine in here as well! Try the roast pork with string beans and hot and sour soup for a special treat.
Good food and service, good place for a hearty meal, not a fancy restaurant.
It is too expensive for a fast food service. But the food is good. It worth the visit for lunch, when prices are around 10 dolars, until 4pm.
Quick to order and take out or eat in #healthy
Always great food. Fast service and delicious tasting.

Be nice or leave. Great sign staring back at you from the other side of the counter. And they are. Neat little diner on Broadway with a mixed menu. They have a great twist on the American classic with the Pizza Burger. Delicious. And the shakes are worth it on their own. Stop by this little joint that once was the stop for Seinfeld and company.

Like most others, we came here because of Seinfeld. Lovely little diner with traditional American comfort food. Grabbed some coffee and a slice of cherry pie, which was delicious. 
Staff were very friendly. 
Overall a great experience!
Cozy and simple diner to eat. A lot of variety on the menu at affordable prices. Also had a sweet waitress from Albania that gave us excellent service.

I didn't read the reviews before traveling all the way to this place but I was excited to see it. We went in and was sat at a table. Staff was very busy talking to each other and pretending to be playing basketball which was very strange. Place was sort of run down especially the bathroom. My boyfriend ordered the kabobs and asked about what the veggies were that came with it. We were told assorted veggies. He loves veggies well he got veggies from a can of mixed canned veggies. Really! $23 dollars for several pieces of meat tons of rice and tons of vegetables from a can. If we knew this we would have just ordered a burger. I ordered the parm and cheese sandwich it was just okay I only ate half of it. We were pretty disapppointed! We took a few pictures which was nice but wished we would have ate somewhere else and just maybe had a dessert here to see the place. Not what we hope it would be for the travel from Manhattan.
An experience, good wait staff.  Nice portions, fast and clean.  Enjoyed my visit and would go back next visit.

This is s cozy restaurant with nice atmosphere.  While sitting deciding what to eat the ceiling started leaking on me. The reaction of the staff was extremely unsatisfactory.  The first response was ill get a towel as the water dropped all over me and my table.  Then after we said we wanted another table they finally moved us. We did not get an apology from the management.  We did not get a drink complimentary. When we addressed the manager with our dissatisfaction. She responded that she stopped the leak as soon as possible and had the food runner leave his position to move us.  My linguine with scallops was good although friend said hers needed salt.  The other member of our party had penne with meatball.  Her tomato sauce was very dry.  With all the restaurants in NY. This place was unsatisfactory and I nor anyone in my party will be returning

We did our online reservation a few weeks before, we arrived 15 minutes early and they were able to give us a table right away (2 people). We were offered sparkling water, and delicious garlic bread. We ordered an entree and a side to share. The spaghetti and meatballs was amazing, ingredients are fresh and food is cooked perfectly. Do not expect wet out-of-a-can pasta and sauce. The side of broccoli rabe was very copious and well seasoned.  They had a special of white sangria pitcher for $10 dollars (AMAZING). So we were able to have a great dinner for two for about $50 dollars, something we really liked as we were on a budget vacation and we prefer to spend our money wisely on quality experiences.

The ambiance is calm and cozy. Also, the area is very nice and we were able to get there on public transportation very quickly. I am not only a Lady Gaga fan, but also very appreciative of delicious food at a reasonable price and great service. Definitively a cherished memory of my  NY trip.
Very Delicious flavor.  Really good service.  The dishes should have been warmer.  Seemed that the food must have been sitting longer than normal but if come back
Excellent Italian restaurant, both inside and outside in the internal patio. Tasty food and well prepared meal authentic Italian options. Courtesy of the staff is truly appreciated. Recommended

I have traveled from Spain to Joe Germanotta's Restaurant and the experience  was amazing! The food was delicious and the restaurant so quiet and relax :) It's was a very good place and my family were very happy with the treat of service and food! 
My mom is vegetarian and she could eat veggie food! 
Thank you very much
$15 for a tasty burrito, but wished it had a bit more veggies in it. Mostly just rice and beans. The salsa was delicious!
Best genuine Mexican burrito in Manhattan. Definitely will be my go to whenever craving something that is not Chipotle
The salsa verde is amazing, and the burrito was also very good
Great, tasty food, the Flautas were particularly divine. Service was also great and fast.
Great quesadillas and salsa verde!
Get your bagel & Lox fix here for brunch! Ask for outdoor seating in the balcony/patio area! Fred's got the best views of the Hollywood Hills!
The food is great! Fantastic View! Would like to have a party there!

I visited the BH location for the first time new years day for my moms birthday brunch and I was rather shocked at the interior condition of the place. It is not nearly as well maintained as the NYC location and there are visible cracks on the walls. I provided the hostess with candles for my moms desert and I would have preferred that they not put in on the desert as supposed to bringing the desert with an unlit candle. The service and food was good and I would most likely return and be seated outside.
At a party poor food
Best view of beverly hills/ next to peninsula - hidden gem and yummy food.

The food is absolutely delicious. We tried the mixed meat platter for two ($55). While the portion is not that big, the taste was mindblowing. We also ordered grilled octopus as appetizer ($16), which was equally as good.

This is what I imagine Sunday dinner is Greece tastes like. We ordered three appetizers and 3 main courses and every dish was absolutely delicious. You may then question, why not 5 stars rather than 4. It was not the food nor the wait staff, both were excellent. No, it was noise and the room temperature. Those discomforts aside I will return for more of Kefi’s delectable food.

The food was very good and extremely filling. As a growing boy, I am usually not completely full after eating out but with just a shared appetizer with a friend and the lamb burger I very happy. The vibe is certainly sophisticated with a great bar for you to meet with a couple of friends for lunch or dinner.
Excellent location on the UWS & atmosphere.  All dishes freshly prepared, healthy & delicious.  Really enjoyed the feta appetizer.  Will definitely return!
Used to love Kefi; wasn’t wowed on a recent visit. Everything was good, nothing was great. Service was pleasant and accommodating.

Absolutely delicious food, Salumeria Rosi is my all time favorite Italian spot in the city. Dishes are fantastic and ambiance is chic, but fun. Its clear the owner and staff care a lot about your experience. I am never disappointed by this gem of a restaurant!!!
