Came here because of Anthony Bourdain and it was totally awesome. Great Italian food at very affordable prices. There's no way you will go wrong at this place. Food is delicious and everyone is very welcoming. Thanks Anthony!
A unique opportunity to eat beyond your dietary needs with a complete absence of guilt. I just got home and wiped out with nary even one drop of alcohol 'cause the food is so exceptional.

Hidden gem. Lots of people think it’s a real deli type place just for hams, wine etc. But this is a full on restaurant with a good menu and brunch options! The place is popular with locals, small and crowded. I got the steak and egg sandwich brunch (shown in picture). For dinner the small plates are great, but we weren’t completely taken in with the pasta (4/5).
Had a lovely evening and wonderful food. Mussels, Bruchetta and meat balls in various dishes. All helped down with some delicious Chianti.

Oh, wow! This place was so good! Everything my partner and I got from appetizers to drinks to entrees to desserts were perfection. I can be pretty picky, but everything was so well balanced- fats and acids, saltiness, creaminess, sweetness, just perfect. I even went in for seconds on the salad, which I never do, but it was just so delicious! Make sure to get dessert, too. The pistachio pudding and the Turkish custard were so great I want to learn how to make them at home.

This place is fantastic.  The service on a Friday night couldn't have been better.  My wife and I share the White Bean Salad (with a dressing that enhanced the flavor of the food, didn't overwhelm it), Zucchini Pancake and Turkish Grill (the meats were done to perfection (the chicken wasn't overcooked as you normally find in restaurants, the pepper was oh so hot and delicious and the cabbage was fresh and delightful).  They just got their liquor license and so the wine selection wasn't great, but was more than adequate for us.

Delicious! Lunch special was only $16 for 3 course w main  and I had enough to take to go. We had Turkish coffee and baklava ( with walnuts - 3 small pieces) to top it off. Staff was attentive too! they sell wine and beer but still let us bring own wine :* thank u

Fantastic Turkish food - It's one of those places where you can tell a lot of care goes into preparing each dish. Their bread is addictive so be careful not to stuff yourself before the actual meal. The atmosphere is great for a business lunch or a date night. My only wish is that they would have lunch specials, but their food is not too pricey so can't really complain.

been here for the first time and what a good experience! location is very nice, food was great, service was perfect. I’ll be back for sure.. ended my dinner with a Turkish tea. got shepherd salad as an appetizer and a HUNKAR bEGENDI (hopefully I wrote it right) as my main. All delicious.
Nice place, good service food very tasty in reasonable price. On photo "Mantu" dunplings filled with meat, price 9,90.

1. No Credit or Debit card accepted  
2. We did reservation for 15 people the floor area  but the place was almost enough for 6 people. Result: many people of our group couldn't join. Almost No customer service.
I liked the Kabili.
Good service and nice food and atmosphere
A super location in the city centre of Hanover. Delicious afghan food. Friendly and courteous service.

Per Se lives in a world of its own. I find it quite unique. Restaurant nicely situated, great views of Columbus. Food amazing, wine list scary, all the usual adjectives apply. What's different is the atmosphere, its actually a fun place to be. Staff likeable and interested. Here's a pasta dish. You can't see pasta 'cos it's hidden behind the biggest mound of truffle I've ever seen. Then they came back and added more! A nice touch. Loved the place, it is serious food, top class dining but also a great place to party. Thanks

This was a very anticipated experience.  Service a d atmosphere were exceptional.  Food very good but expected more of a wow experience, with more intense sauces.  Many dishes. Barely cooked and while delicious were missing pizzazz.  I wonderful experience but I  don't think we will repeat it.

I made a second visit to Per Se this trip. This is a place for a very occasional indulgence unless you are wealthy. Phenomenal food and service. This visit was accentuated by Artis, a fellow Texan who exuded personality and competence. He will go far in the restaurant business with his personal service attitude and love for his employer’s restaurant. There was not a “miss”in the entire meal. Highly recommend if you are a foodie.
Experiences are everything. I've been here twice and both times were well worth it. The food is phenomenal, nothing like it. The service, impeccable the location divine. Must go.
Crazy expensive but almost worth the price! Staff awesome. Food very good. Can't quite justify the $800 lunch for two.

Five stars because of Yuriy. He knows his craft, he handles our requests with professionalism and utmost enthusiasm. He makes my cooking so easy, stress free with great outcome! Thank you Master of Meats! 🙌🏼👍🏼 
He is not there on Thursdays
I love this place. A surprising variety in prepared of foods. From scones to lasagna they have it.
Local grocery feel. Wonderfully pleasant & helpful employees. Grocery offerings are high quality & interesting without traditional name brands.
Wonderful upscale gourmet market. Well known for it prime meats, fresh fish, and a great selection of cheeses. Their prepared foods are also top notch.
Wonderful store with superb produce and meat. Fish is so fresh. Unfortunately little organic products. Take your wallet!

The staff are really really nice here. They take their jobs seriously. They really make it seem like they enjoy making great food to make customers happy and provide excellent customer service. They always make you feel at home and serve you with a smile. So happy with this place! Lots of options, fast, fair pricing, always delicious.
First time here today. The guys behind the deli counter cracked me up they were so funny and pleasant. My sandwich was delicious i will definitely return. It's pricey but worth it for the quality.

I lived in the area for 1.5 years and I probably had a Milano salad around 4 times a week on average... this is my favorite place in Manhattan. And one of the places I miss most from living in NYC. The salad is amazing - so fresh and the highest quality ingredients for only $10!!! (You choose 6 toppings and they put a lot). You stay full for the rest of the day. I’m surprised not all the UWS has discovered this place and the line isn’t down the street. Every time I visit NYC this place is on my must-do list !

We ordered through Doordash. Both sandwiches came with VERY low rate of the “good” ingredients. For example, the M6 sandwich came with basically no avocados, no gruyere and no herb mayo (please see pictures). 
I usually love this place. What prompted me to write a bad review was that when i called, they were so unapologetic and did not care with the fact I have been a client for over 3 years
Best italian heroes north of 42nd Street! Made with care and they don't skimp on ingredients.

Their hot food section is to die for. 

Try their new fries and burgers.... They're the real deal. At mid day they're sometimes giving out samples. Look for the lady with the big plate of free food
When I go there, I cannot complain.  The food is fantastic. Most staffs are pleasant and polite. The walk over here is good.

Great place. Excellent build a salad section. The price is unbelievable for Manhattan. Salads for $5?!? That's cheaper than Jersey. Been there only for lunchtime (3weeks). Everytime I've been there the lunch is on point. The hot food section is great and the people there are very nice.
A busy market with a huge supply of fresh fruits and veg. Fabulous salad bar. Excellent fish. House prepared meals.

Nope... i've been here dozens of times (thanks to the paucity of decent supermarkets in NYC), and I really can't endorse this place. Some of the prepared food is decent/good, some is gross. One or two of the employees are super friendly, several are super rude. It's usually quite crowded and a frustrating shopping experience. Some items are way overpriced.
